Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: This blend of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc comes from the proprietor's Cliff Lede Vineyard. Structured, richly layered and dense, it is seamless, focused and full of intense tension, with notes of currant, raspberry, rose and violet. Drink 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 Poetry Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: An initially muted floral tone develops into complex and cohesive aromas of iron, cigar and currant. Textured and lifted, it shows plenty of structure and graceful power that will do well to let settle further. Enjoy from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: From an amazingly warm, rocky site, this wine swarms in velvety baked fruit and youthful grip. It shows complex layers of crushed rock, iron and earth. The exuberantly vibrant yet rich core weaves together notes of cocoa powder, currant, black pepper and tobacco. Drink 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: The famous site helps to impart classical earthiness and herbal intensity to this wine, offering notes of crushed rock, iron, cedar and compost. Hugely structured and powerfully built, it shows an array of rich black fruit, oak and tannin, begging for time. Enjoy best from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Chocolate-covered-blueberry flavors come to the fore of this tremendously impressive, delicious and complex wine, muscularly built with substantial tannin and structure. Accents of cigar box, clove and dried herb give it a varietal flourish that adds intrigue and contrast, balancing the richness with elegance. Enjoy best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer Bourn Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a broad and lushly rich wine from the great site, with soft, rounded edges that give it appeal and accessibility across the refined palate. Firm, integrated tannins provide structure with ease, boosting well-defined flavors of black cherry, waxy plum and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer Georges III Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: From an estate site near the top of the Napa Valley, this wine is rich, lengthy and supple in black cherry, cassis and well-integrated oak and tannin. Lushly rich, it offers complexity and structure within that context, finishing in a taste of crushed rock, tobacco and black pepper. It should age well; enjoy best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Venge 2018 Bone Ash Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Description: Cedar, earth and sage define the beginning of this grippy, powerful wine that exudes all the elegance and intensity of the site. Black cherry, black licorice and textured tannins balance the savory earthiness and edge. This will do well with more aging; enjoy from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this showers the nose with complex aromas of dark cocoa, black olive, peppercorn, tar, espresso and mint. There's a creamy and focused cassis kick to the sip, but it's the slightly bitter coffee and charred earth aspects that are most compelling.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pius 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)

Description: This is a blockbuster of a wine, especially at the price, opening in violet aromas and moderate grip. Beautiful black- and red-cherry, currant and baking-spice elements combine around a core of classic elegance and length, finishing in cigar box. The fruit is from four estate sites. Consider buying caseloads.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Turnbull 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Etched in sage, cedar and pencil shaving, this is a burly, textured and grippy wine, with notes of charcoal and toasted oak. The fruit is black and broodingly rich, held within a foundation of firm, integrated tannin and balanced power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Nomad Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a robust, deeply concentrated wine, richly layered and densely textured in red fruit, crushed rock, sage and cedar. Grippy tannins reveal its youthful vigor and relative restraint that is not ready to rush out of the gate quite yet. Let the power deepen and develop further in the cellar and enjoy from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 Magic Nights Rock Block Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: With 13% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc, this is a powerfully masterful, complex and memorable wine from winemaker Christopher Tynan from two sites, including Madrona Ranch. A sweetness of blackberry is complemented by toasted oak and a soft, supple richness of lengthy baking spice and dried herb. This is ageworthy; enjoy best from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 Songbook Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Cassis, leather, underbrush and blue flower aromas mingle in the glass. Structured and loaded with finesse, the polished, linear palate delivers juicy black cherry, black currant, star anise and wild herbs framed in taut, refined tannins. Drink through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Isole e Olena 2016 Collezione Privata Cabernet Sauvignon (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost opaque in the glass, this luxury bottling entices with intense aromas of black currant and blackberry sauce on the nose, with savory hints of dark olive and caramel spice. It's quite dry on the palate, where licorice, violet and cassis flavors linger amidst the polished tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2017 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot and sealed in barrels with wooden bungs for three-to-six-month intervals, this estate-grown wine is hearty and complex, deeply concentrated in dark black fruit, with muscular tannin. Coffee bean, turned earth, black currant and cedar all pop on the lengthy palate, showing room to age. Enjoy best from 2027–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: J.O. Sullivan Founder's Reserve Estate Grown
Name: Sullivan 2017 J.O. Sullivan Founder's Reserve Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Blended with 13% Merlot and smaller amounts of Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, this is a focused and youthfully grippy wine, showing a fervor of succulent red- and black-currant and licorice. Thick, rich and intensely structured, it possesses a mineral-like earthiness of crushed rock and enduring structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cliff Lede 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: From a site at 1,100-feet elevation, this impressive wine is thick and grippy in lavender, licorice and baked plum and dark cherry. With a length and breadth of cedar and dark chocolate, it shows balance between the power and concentration, its tannins structured and age-worthy. Enjoy best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mueller Family Vineyards 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Silky red fruit and plum dot the landscape of this powerfully soft and velvety wine. Blended with 23% Merlot and 1% each of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, it exudes classic structure, integrated oak and floral beauty, finishing on a fig note. Enjoy from 2028–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chimney Rock 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: A 100% varietal wine from the producer's estate vineyards, this is a beautifully burly mountain wine, brimming in cedar, tobacco and dark, brooding black currant and berry. Richly savory and thickly concentrated, it has benefitted from time in bottle, coming around now with a lilt of lavender.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paratus 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Description: Velvety thick in caramel, oak and rich layers of dark fruit, this wine offers hints of cedar and dried herb that complement and help to make it more complex. Made in a generous, full-bodied style, it shows heft and depth, the tannins structured and robust.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Phelps 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a spicy, earthy and densely rich wine from the famous site, tingling in acidity and broad strokes of leather, nutmeg and blackberry. Full bodied and made to age, it shows graceful structure in the works, with well-mannered tannin and toasted oak tones. Enjoy best from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Perchance 2018 Beckstoffer Georges III Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine vastly overdelivers on its price point—a rarity in its category and peers. Made from grapes throughout the appellation, the majority from St. Helena, it blends in small amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cab Franc. Turned earth, pungent tobacco leaf and currant define its savory, substantially structured elegance that offers room to age.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ramey 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Red fruit foward, with traces of baking spice and generous oak notes, this is a soft, supple and complex wine. Full bodied in style, with a hit of power and ripeness, it offers contrasting elements of savory, earthy and rich tones.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Cypress Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Woody, herbal and spicy in black pepper and clove, this bold, complete wine is layered and complex in structure. Notes of tobacco, dark chocolate, iron and meat highlight a muscular, grippy style that is built for aging. Enjoy from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Lot No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Chiseled cedar, sandalwood and balsam aromas meet with dry elderberry, baked earth and black-olive aromas on the savory nose of this bottling. Toasty flavors of dark, bittersweet chocolate made for a dry palate, where toasted wood and elderberry-jam touches are framed by firm tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2017 The Bridge Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed rocks and loamy soil make for a mineral-laced entry to the nose of this savory, black-olive and plum-laced bottling, which also includes 5% each Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Charred blackberry and roasted meat flavors show on the sip, with a touch of black pepper and soy.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2018 The Assassin Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Smoked oak and grilled meat with a bite of char give this wine a savory, succulent and memorable personality, amid firm, integrated tannin and brooding black fruit. Well put together, it is enjoyable from start to finish, showing a complex thread of earthiness and earthy dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: After 20 months in French oak, this wine remains youthful and tightly wound, showing notes of dark chocolate, tobacco leaf, cigar and blueberry cobbler. Firm, prominent tannins and a mineral component of crushed rock give it length and added complexity. Enjoy from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Guarachi Family 2017 Meadowrock Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An intense blackberry aroma is surrounded by savory, mineral tones of crushed granite, turned loam and charred meat on the nose of this bottling. Black plum and lavender emerge on the sip, where rich tannins deliver dark cardamom spice as well as more savory rock and meat elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Deep and dense in blue and red fruit, this full-bodied wine is robustly concentrated and rich by design, thick in added notes of dark chocolate and cigar box. Sage, dried herb and black pepper contribute complexity and earthiness, the tannins lengthy and beginning to be supple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: This wine offers outstanding value for a high-quality experience. It is blended with 18% Merlot and tastes of cassis, red cherry and blueberry. The lifted acidity brings in a tease of grapefruit. The palate is fleshy and lengthy, with plenty of complexity, elegance and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Sante 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is made from the best barrels of the vintage, an exploration of intense mountain fruit, sage, tree bark and turned earth that is grippy and thick on the palate. The red is 100% varietal and was given 22 months in new French oak. It finishes in clove and a dash of vanilla; enjoy best from 2028–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paratus 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Description: From winemaker Julien Fayard, who knows his way around the appellation, this red is soft and plush in tannin, with rich layers of chocolate mocha, cedar and sage. The savory, earthy components continue to complement with a texture of crushed rock, with a backbone of enviable structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Récoltant 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish baking spices and fully ripe plum and black-cherry flavors give plenty to savor in this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. It offers power with polish, as a mouthfilling fruitiness is amplified by cinnamon, nutmeg and cedar from oak barrels.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: With 17% Cabernet Franc and a smidgen of Petit Verdot, this dense, full-bodied red opens in mocha, tobacco and black pepper and licorice, presenting as savory more than fruity. Currant and cranberry notes add to the complex mix of lively freshness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Fifth Empire 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Herbal, earthy and bright in cassis, red currant and cherry, this mountain wine is lengthy in baking spice, sage and a hint of tobacco. With considerable tannin, it is beginning to integrate and show breadth across the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean lines of black cherry and creamy berry met with warm pastry, a touch of oak and a light slate minerality on the nose of this bottling. It lands richly on the palate, where the lush black-currant and blueberry-cream flavors are cut by bright acidity and a tense tannic profile.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (El Pomar District)

Description: This is a robustly intense and brooding wine, firm and thick in tannin and dark, dense fruit. Tobacco, black licorice and woody oak round it out and provide a contrast of complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Caspar 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A single-vineyard effort, this shows plenty of Bourbon tea and tobacco highlights right away, along with tasty cherry fruit that is already leaning into secondary flavors with an autumnal cast. Like its companion Merlot, it's drinking smooth and tasty, with lots of vanilla and tea and tobacco front and center. These are wines to open and drink over the next couple of years as the chances of further improvement are unpredictable.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cória 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This red begins with aromas of a black-cherry sundae, complete with caramel, whipped cream and nuts, as well as a bit of coffee. There's just enough bite to the tannins on the sip to uphold those lush qualities.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Smith & Hook 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Description: Thick, dusty, textured and made in a full-bodied style, this wine succeeds in its complementary marriage between savory cedar, cigar and pencil shavings and dark black fruit dipped in chocolate shavings. Lengthy, it has 5% Cabernet Franc, which appears to add violet aromas and additional herbal characteristics.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brambly blackberry aromas meet with savory oregano, marjoram and balsam on the nose of this bottling. There is a woody streak to the palate, where cedar tones frame the dark blackberry and black-plum flavors, with savory soy and mushroom elements arising toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Biddle Ranch 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This is an impressive red that overdelivers on its price point, providing a graceful experience of powerful concentration. Black fruit, iron, crushed rock and cedar define its yin-yang of Old World sensibility with New World intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Mondavi 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This represents solid value for the solid quality— an expressive wine in dark rich cherry, cinnamon and vanilla notes and one that is sticky in tannin and shows plenty of structure. Blended with small amounts of Cab Franc, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot, it remains light on the palate in integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2018 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Description: This Cab delivers plenty of power and flavor, blended with 13% Merlot and 4% Petite Sirah. Lively and approachable, the tobacco, tomato leaf, cedar and dried herb complement the richness of berry and plum cradled in sweet oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bear Flag 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Description: Buzzing acidity adorns this otherwise powerfully full-bodied wine, made from a range of appellations, including Atlas Peak and Howell Mountain. Earthy dried herb, sage and cedar complement core of lengthy oak, tannin and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Laely 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: An entirely varietal wine from the producer's estate vineyard in coolish Oak Knoll, this wine shows hearty layers of dark plum, cherry and cassis with darker, denser complements of tobacco and oak. Fig, chocolate and tobacco add to the appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Silenus 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Suave and smoky aromas of grated cocoa, grilled berries and a hint of dried blood show on the nose of this bottling. Slightly tart baked berry flavors kick off the sip, where cedar and herb elements add complexity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2018 Briarwood Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Saucy black plum aromas are joined by notes of vanilla and tomato, while this is composed on a tight, dry palate. Plum and currant flavors include a hint of chocolate, while this performs an easy fade on a healthy, fresh finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Gaia Made With Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Gualtallary)

Description: This wine benefits from the addition of 22% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc, which contribute floral aromatics and soft texture. From a site at the bottom of Spring Mountain, it offers thick, concentrated dark fruit and savory components of cedar, tobacco, black olive and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Duckhorn 2017 Patzimaro Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: An American-oak barrel-aged wine, this offers great value and balance, made in an Old World, restrained and classical style of subdued earthiness and dried herb. Notes of black currant, coffee bean and tobacco add complex savory elements that give it varietal appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Meyer Family Cellars 2018 Spitfire Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Black-fruit aromas are ripe and come with hints of rubber and road tar. On the palate, this is snappy and lively, with healthy acidity and dry tannins. A mix of black plum, blackberry, prune and spice flavors finishes firm and dry; drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Salentein 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

Description: With a pungent earthiness, this wine is silky smooth and inviting in dark black fruit, tobacco and oak. The tannins settle to show structure but in an unobtrusive way, making way for lasting notes of dark chocolate, cola and pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Récoltant 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas with a touch of grit and spice are familiar to anyone who knows and likes Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is crisp and juicy, with good structure. Earthy black plum, blackberry and cassis flavors are ripe but restrained, while this is not too complex or demanding finishing with lingering black-fruit flavors. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Gran Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft aromas of baked cherry meet with rich mahogany and cola on the nose of this bottling. The palate picks up shiitake, pepper and tar flavors, with sticky tannins that carry the ripe red fruit to the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2018 Shotwell Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (El Pomar District)

Description: With a touch of earthiness, this wine is leathery and has tremendous grip. Ripe, rich layers of black fruit, clove and cola round it out, with 5% Cabernet Franc contributing a hint of violet.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bougetz 2017 Jetrois Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: Notes of iron, crushed rock and freshly turned earth complement an array of dried herb and Old World style in this full-bodied, well-made wine. Supple tannins give it a rounded likability and lasting brightness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: De Sante 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: Compelling aromas of wood, nutmeg and currant lead the way to a generous ripeness, breadth and body weight in this mountain-grown wine. The tannin structure is hearty and supportive, integrating into the ample oak and dense fruit with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Description: This full-bodied wine marshalls generous black-fruit and oak-spice flavors and wraps them in fine-grained tannins for a velvety texture that is mouth-watering. Satisfyingly ripe black cherries and blackberries meet light vanilla and cedar accents from oak barrels.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ryer Estate 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried and baked berry aromas meet with cedar, oak, tar and char on the nose of this bottle. The woody flavors also show on the sip, which is loaded with balsam, incense and just enough ripe red fruit to provide balance.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2018 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shy at first on the nose, this bottling opens to reveal aromas of dark berry, dried earth and oregano. The tannic profile is firm on the palate, ensuring some cellar stamina, with flavors of blackberry, herb and a brick-like minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Josh Cellars 2018 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: With 11% Merlot, this is a rich, herbal and earthy red wine from the famous appellation. The palate is viscous, with flavors of blueberry, blackberry and nutmeg.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kirkland Signature 2018 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: This lively and spicy wine combines aromas of black pepper and cherries with green-olive and bell-pepper flavors that are characteristic of the grape variety. Medium body, mild tannins and decent acidity give it good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: California Refined 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This robust, smoky, spicy wine offers plenty of oak character via aromas of clove, charcoal and tobacco, and flavors of cedar, cinnamon and vanilla that accompany red- and black-cherry fruit. Medium body and light tannins keep it easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Voyager Point 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas dark cherry, black currant, coffee, tar and cinnamon carry the lush nose of this bottling. Fine-grained tannins frame the intensely layered sip, holding up deep flavors of cassis, blueberry and dried beef, with touches of espresso and sesame seed adding intrigue. Daniel Daou's tannin management regime shines brightly here.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2018 Family Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Tangy in red fruit, tangerine, grapefruit and a hint of iron, this vineyard-designate imparts bold, concentrated intensity within a restrained and balanced package of brightness and verve. From a relatively warm vintage and warm location, it retains nuance, elegance and length, with structure to age. Enjoy this impressively made wine best from 2027–2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Corison 2017 Kronos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Description: From a high-elevation site in what is now Moon Mountain, as well as a smaller vineyard on the valley floor, both estate, this red opens with a fragrant nose of rose and cherry. Blended with 11% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec, the palate follows in a contrast of tart currant and earthy, herbal components of cedar, pencil and sage. Structured and elegant, drink from 2026–2036.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stone Edge Farm 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine comes from marquee vineyards along the Rutherford bench, where gravelley soils dominate. An Old World nose of cedar, tobacco and dried herb lead to a soft, supple core of sultry black cherry, blackberry and nutmeg, with a lingering taste of licorice adding complex intrigue to the integrated tannin and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cornerstone 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: This is an outstanding study in blending: bringing together the grapes of 11 vineyards across the valley and bringing in 2% Malbec and 2% Merlot. Juicy in dark cherry, plum and a fleshy, full-bodied midpalate, it is built around supple tannins and an enduring exuberance of balanced richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Venge 2018 Silencieux Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A Schrader-related wine made by Thomas Rivers Brown, this 100% varietal wine is a showcase of the appellation, wide in appeal and bold, ripe red fruit. Sage, tar, cedar and pencil provide varietal complexity and contrast to the fruit; the tannins are integrated yet still grippy. Enjoy best from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Double Diamond 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Making lower alcohol Cabernet Sauvignon is a fascinating step for the Daou brothers, who've always pushed ripeness and depth. This bottling is full of umami character, showing bloody steak flavors, but also dark plum, charred blueberry and purple flowers. The palate displays toasted nut, grilled lamb and dried flowers, and it only grows more fascinating the longer its open. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2018 Cherem Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A deep blackberry aroma meets with licorice and mushroom on the fresh and savory nose. The palate's black currant and blueberry core is partnered harmoniously with notes of chipped wood and toasted herbs as well as jubilant acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ancient Peaks 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Showing excellent depth and impressive concentration, this full-bodied and well-balanced wine impresses with focused black-fruit flavors, a creamy texture and beautifully integrated tannins that afford a velvety mouthfeel. So delicious now, but it will be best after 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fortress 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this aged bottling begins with an herbal kick of toasted thyme alongside baked earth, chiseled stone and tart fruit. The palate is quite tarry in texture and flavor, with ripe blackberry and black-cherry elements playing against a slightly bitter herb tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Justin 2015 Platinum Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Herbal and chalky, this full-bodied wine is surprisingly bright in acidity, helping to quell the rich notions of blueberry, red cherry and cinnamon. The oak adds additional spice and vanilla, weaving easily within the dense layers of texture and tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Deeply concentrated and nicely packed with fine-grained tannins, this full-bodied wine takes a classic approach that's so enjoyable to sniff and savor. Black currant, black cherry, mint and cedar intermingle in the nose and on the palate, bringing great generosity backed by chewy tannins. It's beautiful now but can easily age past 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Nelson Family Vineyards 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Description: Earthy with a touch of leather, cigar box and crushed rock, this muscular, boldly ripe red is complex and structured, with a hearty imprint of oak and tannin. Blue and red fruit provide richness and a tang of freshness to the powerful varietal expression.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Earthy with a touch of leather, cigar box and crushed rock, this muscular, boldly ripe red is complex and structured, with a hearty imprint of oak and tannin. Blue and red fruit provide richness and a tang of freshness to the powerful varietal expression.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crescere 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Waxy plum and dark cherry are layered and softly integrated into supple tannins and a length of toasted oak in this vineyard-designate, with a length of cedar and dried herb. The earthiness provides a savory contrast to the vibrancy of the fruit and underlying acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: The Paint of Moonlight Pelkan Ranch
Name: Chiron Wines 2016 The Paint of Moonlight Pelkan Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Description: This Cabernet includes small amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot in the blend. Aged 21 months in a majority of new oak, it tastes of toast and deliciously ripe red fruit, with substantial concentration, structure and intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sky Devil 2018 Formation Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Juicy in dark cherry, red currant and cassis, this is a bright wine with elongated tannin grip and an impressive length of integrated oak. Earthy, with notes of cedar, tobacco and sage, it delivers balanced elegance amidst understated power and ripeness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and focused aromas of chiseled slate and stone meet with intense boysenberry and vanilla liqueur on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are firm yet lavish on the sip, where roasted fig and plum flavors meet with espresso bean and finish on a black cherry and vanilla kick.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Lanterns 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Perfumed in rose and sage, this mountain-grown wine is oak-driven and intensely built, with crushed rock minerality and textured tannins. Structured and generously ripe, it offers dense, brooding layers of leather, tobacco and black cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Description: Earthy and leathery in concentrated layers of dark cherry and currant, this robust, generous wine is soft and well integrated in terms of both oak and tannin. The fruit is seasoned in tobacco, nutmeg and a touch of vanilla, adding to its overall richness and refined exuberance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chocolate and cherry flavors rise up from the glass, with plenty of coffee, spice and dried herb accents along with them. The palate brings bountiful tannin along with a zing of acidity. There's a whole lot of structure here. It will have an extremely long life ahead of it. Best after 2028.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cedar, spice, chocolate and cherry cordial aromas lead to a layered, plush palate with plentiful plum and cedar flavors. There's detail to it all and also superb balance and structure.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Barons 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: This wine benefits from the addition of 9% Oakville Cabernet Franc and tiny smidgens of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Together, they boost a thicket of rich red fruit, earthy dried herb and concentrated intensity—the tannins fine-grained and well integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cornerstone 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Description: With small elements of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc blended in, this nicely made red is bright and supple in addition to being well integrated. Herbal back notes of cedar and sage provide earthy context to the darkly brooding black fruit, finishing in a grip of tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Amici 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the first reserve level wine to come from this new producer, and it delivers. With all of the fruit coming from Olsen Vineyard, there's plenty of nuance to the aromas of dried and fresh herbs, baker's chocolate, raspberry, graphite and cherry. Soft fruit and barrel flavors follow, bringing sophistication and elegance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Virtue 2018 Eloquence Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Description: Just a microscopic amount of this wine was made. The wine's big, bold style is softened by sumptuous red fruit encased in vanilla oak and decadent tannin. Broad across the midpalate, it offers a length of intensity seasoned in cedar, dried herb and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 The Chop Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of char, roasted coffee bean, dark chocolate and cherry topped with sweet spices. The flavors are rich with a seamless feel. It hangs on the coffee- and cherry-filled finish. Dee-licious.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Baer 2017 Arctos Stillwater Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee and spice aromas are out front, followed by notes of cherry, clove and raspberry. On the palate, there is a lovely sense of balance, layering, restraint and depth. The raspberry-filled finish sticks around for a very long time. It's delicious. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of smoky oak, ripe berries and caramelized cherries make for a lush nose in this reserve bottling. It lands large on the palate, with smoked meat, black-cherry compote and oak-dust flavors, framed by firm tannins that slip into a caramel-sauce finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Smith & Hook 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Made by Julien Fayard for former race-car driver Danica Patrick, this is a thick, substantially structured wine blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. It shows graphite, lead, tar and tobacco tones. It's unabashedly savory and earthy in style, with quiet red and black fruit framed by oak. Enjoy from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Somnium 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of coffee, vanilla, graphite, green herb and dark cherry. Bright fruit flavors follow, backed by chewy tannins. It's flavorful but deft, lingering on the finish, with a nice yum factor. Give it some time in the decanter to open up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Foolhardy 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of coffee, vanilla, graphite, green herb and dark cherry. Bright fruit flavors follow, backed by chewy tannins. It's flavorful but deft, lingering on the finish, with a nice yum factor. Give it some time in the decanter to open up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Foolhardy 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Rich in jammy plum and blackberry, this bold, expressive wine offers generous layers of iron and garrigue as well. Dusty texture accentuates a structure of firm, integrated tannin and substantial oak, leading the way to an unabashedly ripe finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Yao Family Wines 2017 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of green herb, cocoa, coffee and dark fruit are followed by plump fruit flavors with lightly grainy tannins backing them up. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's a surefire crowd-pleaser. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried cedar, light cola, crushed corks, wild-fennel and dark-berry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate's woody frame is also bold, offering mahogany spice against sandy tannins, which wrap around the dark-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lexington 2016 Gist Ranch Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and driven aromas of black plum, cocoa, violet, tar and balsam show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Clean lines of blackberry and black plum cut across the palate, where woody flavors of sandalwood and incense lead into a damp forest finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 Sevastien Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: A soft, velvety core of rich chocolate mocha and graham cracker provide a foundation of hearty full-bodied intensity in this appellation wine, which shows nuanced elements of crushed rock and iron. The mineral earthiness helps to complement its big style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost half of this wine comes from Tapteil Vineyard on Red Mountain, with most of the rest from Stillwater Creek on the Royal Slope. The aromas aren't ready to reveal themselves at present, with brooding notes of baker's chocolate, spice, anise, raspberry and black cherry. The raspberry and cherry flavors are rounded in feel while retaining deftness. There are lots of good things happening.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though showing a touch of age, this wine is still very much alive, beginning with aromas of deep cherry, cedar, mahogany and black olive. The hearty palate is full of black olive and dank shiitake flavors, with baked blackberry and wood shavings leading into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Bon Vivant Destiny Vineyards Derek Heights Section
Name: Hunt Cellars 2014 Bon Vivant Destiny Vineyards Derek Heights Section Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Focused aromas of blackberry wrapped in cedar and dusted with milk chocolate show on the nose of this bottling. There's a hit of mint on the sip, alongside blackberry cream and vanilla, with sandy tannins holding the fruit together.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Concentrated, focused and ultrasmooth, this well-polished wine is a winner. Velvety fine-grained tannins bolster deep blackberry and black-currant flavors while light oak spices of vanilla and cinnamon accentuate its complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Plungerhead 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with the notes of cocoa and graphite not fully ready to show themselves. The palate is light initially but with plenty of structure, stretching out over time. Showing some reduction, this one needs some additional bottle age. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Prospice 2018 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's plenty of complexity to the raspberry, cherry, fresh herb, vanilla and smoke aromas. The coffee and cherry flavors deliver on all of that promise.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Basel Cellars 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Handsome, smooth and layered, this full-bodied wine marries plenty of delicious ripe black plums and blueberries with well-integrated oak accents of vanilla, cedar and cinnamon. Its texture is velvety, braced by fine-grained tannins that seamlessly support wonderful fruit and mocha notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: B Side 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Chocolate, spice and maraschino cherry aromas are followed by plush, layered, but far from over the top fruit flavors. It's unabashed in its appeal, with a lot of structure to back it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Barons 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: With 10% Petite Sirah and 7% Malbec, this Cabernet Sauvignon is effusively bright in dense layers of fruit. A moderate grip of tannin helps to give it additional power and length around a juicy midpalate of blueberry and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2018 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-red cherry and berry aromas meet with cedar, light dried herbs and graphite elements on the nose of this bottling. There is a firm texture to the sip, where fresh red-fruit flavors are dusted in mocha spices, providing ripe but refreshing with acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: St. Huberts The Stag 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from the White Bluffs region, this wine offers aromas of raspberry and chocolate alongside a sprinkling of dried herb. The flavors are dense and ripe but polished and well-balanced. It's a lovely wine made in an opulent style. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Winescape 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Intensely chalky tannins surround cedar and dried herb notes in this robustly built, concentrated and grippy wine. Weighty earthiness leads the way to flavors of tobacco, sage and black pepper, overshadowing the dense, black fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas and flavors of cocoa, coconut, baking spice and black cherry run throughout. There's a pleasant balance across it all, with the fruit and barrel both playing a big part in the show.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Alki 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Juicy red fruit informs this rich, soft and approachable wine, made in small amounts from an estate block of grapes. Raspberry, coconut and vanilla combine around thick layers of texture and body weight, boosted by integrated oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2016 Ranch House Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine that is immensely intense and reductive at first, this is a burly blockbuster of toasted oak, cedar, black fruit and gunpowder. Powerfully built, it is richly layered: a study in tobacco, crushed rock and dark chocolate, the wine made by Aaron Pott.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Somnium 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Woody, herbal and savory in sage and tree bark, this wine is substantially full bodied and thick in texture. With 11% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, it was given 22 months in French oak, only a small percentage of it new.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Fifth Empire 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: The classic varietal character of this sturdy and spicy wine involves light sage and olive scents joined by plenty of red-cherry and black-cherry flavors. Cedar and cinnamon accents come from oak aging and a nicely grippy texture begs for food.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Winery SF 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Description: This is a well-made wine crafted in a big style that is leathery, sultry and softly layered in baking spice and up-front oak. Underlying the grip and wood are brighter elements of cassis and currant that help to complement and balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peter Paul Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Intensely chalky tannins surround cedar and dried herb notes in this robustly built, concentrated and grippy wine. Weighty earthiness leads the way to flavors of tobacco, sage and black pepper, overshadowing the dense, black fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a thick, concentrated wine, stylistically full bodied but possessed of elegance and grace. Pencil shaving, dried herb, cedar and berry round out a silky midpalate of well-behaved tannin and integrated oak, with lasting structure to boot.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2014 Six Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a completely satisfying wine, beginning with black cherry, vanilla, oak, dried oregano and mint on the nose. The body is fairly light, but has just enough tannic bones to frame those ripe cherry and roasted berry flavors, with a savory line of smoke down the middle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chronic Cellars 2019 Sir Real Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine represents tremendous value for the price and case production, mixed with a small amounts of supporting varieties. Smoky in grilled meat flavor, it has a velvety plushness to the texture and balanced tannins, the dark baked fruit adding richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oberon 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Oregano and peppercorn aromas make for an herbal introduction to the nose of this bottling, which also features dried berry and olive elements. Smoothed-out tannins frame flavors of leather, dried berry and coffee bean on the palate, which has a creamy mouthfeel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rava 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Blended with small amounts of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Malbec, this likable pour offers perfumed red fruit and bright acidity within a full-bodied, integrated core of smooth texture. A background of herbal notes complements the dense black cherry and blackberry core.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2018 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Cedar, oak and dried herb season a full-bodied, concentrated core of black fruit in this robustly built and intense red wine. Dark-chocolate shavings add to the richness and luxurious mouthfeel, leading to a finishing touch of coconut and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2014 Ranch House Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The age on this bottling is starting to show, but there's a lot of compelling life left. Aromas of cherry cordial, leather and cocoa lead into a palate full of dried meat, dried berry and more cocoa spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hunt Cellars 2014 Cloud 9 Grand Reserve Destiny Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Herbal with highlights of cedar and pencil shaving, this is an Old World red with 20 months of French-oak aging that impresses in its grippy tannin profile and lively midpalate. Savory throughout, it makes room to reveal black currant and cranberry, adding to the tangy intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2015 Six Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Dark berry dominates a waxy texture in this soft, gently tannic wine—a likably approachable and value-minded offering that delivers full flavor within a graceful frame.                      Virginie Boone
Name: St. Supéry 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with 20% Merlot and given 20 months in all new French oak, this is a smoothly intense, powerfully concentrated wine. Black currant and licorice highlight an earthy core of leathery barnyard and generously toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pestoni Family 2017 Three Tears Vineyard Block B Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-berry aromas meet with ample amounts of mint, espresso bean and oak on the nose of this bottling. Firm-enough tannins frame the sip, where dark morello cherry and baked earth flavors are held in place by dusty tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2017 Sherlock's Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-berry aromas meet with ample amounts of mint, espresso bean and oak on the nose of this bottling. Firm-enough tannins frame the sip, where dark morello cherry and baked earth flavors are held in place by dusty tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broken Earth 2017 Sherlock's Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Creamy aromas of strawberry and rose petals are contrasted by light mint on the dense nose of this bottling. There is a Dr Pepper spice on the sip, lifting up the purple-fruit flavors, and wrapped in a grippy structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Three Daughters Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark chocolate, baking spice and black cherry aromas are followed by plump, rich fruit flavors. It's a hedonistic delight. Decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Canoe Ridge Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of spice and cedar lead to almost creamy feeling blueberry and plum flavors. It brings an appealing texture, although not immediately identifiable as Cabernet.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Intrinsic 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a screaming deal for such well-made wine, brawny in toasted oak notes that support a hearty core of soft, supple black cherry and currant. With 5% Merlot, it is approachable, wide in appeal and emphatically delicious.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2018 Y3 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of blackberry jam and violet meet with hints of oregano and grilled meat on the nose of this bottling. There's an herbal-tea tone to the sip, full of oregano, bay and peppercorns, as well as more berry jam at the core, all framed by grippy, coffee-like tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Banshee 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: With a note of reduction on the nose, this deeply concentrated wine shows notes of leather, cola and toasted oak within a length of cinnamon, cedar and dill.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pestoni Family 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: Minty red berry and plum aromas are lightly herbal, which is typical of Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon. A racy palate with popping acidity is offset by oak, while spicy blackberry and plum flavors are peppery and honest prior to a solid finish with driving acidity. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2019 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

Description: Juicy aromas of black cherry, mint and cola are approachable and easy to like on the nose of this bottling, which is aimed at a new generation of wine lovers. It's ripe and playful on the palate, where the big fruit flavors are enhanced by cocoa and mint and framed in delicate tannins that strengthen toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Uncorked by Cosmopolitan 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are alluring, with notes of dried herb, bittersweet chocolate, anise and cherry cordial. The palate has a bit of fruit sweetness that seems out of place. It needs a bit more structure to fully stand it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Winescape 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: This concentrated, firmly tannic wine packs plenty of black cherry and blackberry flavors in a rich, gripping texture. A full body and deep black-fruit flavors will make it pair well with big proteins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cannonball 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, cola, vanilla and a pinch of dried herbs show on the nose of this ripe yet layered bottling. There's enough tension on the palate to frame the dark-fruit and herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 7 Cellars 2019 The Farm Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of plum, blueberry and sweet spice are forward. Plum and Satsuma orange flavors follow, giving a plush feel, with a slight dip in the middle but finishing with brightness on the back end.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Adrice 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cherry, caramel, mahogany, licorice and wild-desert-herb aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a unique corner of Los Angeles County. A firm grip frames the sip, where flavors of tobacco leaf meet with hearty berry tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Agua Dulce 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Description: This superconcentrated wine is a bit stiff to drink now but should have a good maturity ahead. Packed tightly with blackberry, cranberry and black cherry, it carries hints of baking spices and toasted oak as well as espresso and cocoa. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meadow View 2018 Isabelle's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Lamorinda)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This firm-textured, sturdily built wine supports fragrant and complex oak spice and black-fruit flavors with nicely gripping tannins. Enjoyable vanilla, cinnamon and cedar notes start in the aroma and continue through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathew Gibson 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wild-berry aromas meet with stemmy herbs and a hint of licorice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with sage and thyme, giving herbal nuance to the tangy blackberry and black-currant flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jalama 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: Earthy, peppery accents highlight this full-bodied wine that is centered on mulled cherry and herbal flavors backed by moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: High Valley Vineyard 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (High Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Bright black-cherry and black-pepper aromas lead to vivid black-fruit flavors on a tangy, slightly tannic texture and full body. It's a sturdy, appetizing wine to enjoy with meats or cheeses.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dancing Crow 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black-cherry aromas are complemented by vanilla, star anise and nutmeg on the rich nose of this bottling. Kirsch-like flavors show on the sip, with strong mace spice in the midpalate, leading into crushed rocks and tobacco towards the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lightpost 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Easygoing and rather rich in warm blueberry and black-cherry flavors, this medium-bodied wine sports just enough tannin for a velvety mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hess Select 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Description: Olive tapenade and black-licorice flavors meet a core of jammy black cherry in this soft, supple and richly ripe wine. Dried herb accents find companionship in a wealth of toasted, vanilla-kissed oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Quilt 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine is thick and earthy, with savory components of leather, tobacco and cedar. The oak is toasted and prominent, boosted by generous tannins.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Valravn 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strongly reedy aromas of dried herb meet with crushed slate, juicy blackberry and fruit punch on the nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied on the palate, where the punchy flavors are elevated by pinches of herb and earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bold 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: With 10% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Franc blended in, this bold red is hearty and thick, with notes of baking spice and black pepper seasoning its underlying earthiness of dried herb. The fruit is a mix of baked plum and dark cherry with a richness of mocha.                      Virginie Boone
Name: No Name Road 2018 Route 101 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Thick tannins surround a burly core of black currant and dark cherry in this highly ripe, concentrated wine, made 100% varietal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peju 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: San Francisco Bay, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intense aromas of smoked blackberry, fennel, pencil shavings and caramel-laced fudge show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the East Bay. The palate is a bit tangy with tart cherry and plum-skin flavors, as a sharp acidity lifts light lavender elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Big Dog 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Francisco Bay)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are unusual, with notes of fresh tangerine peel, olive meat and smoke. The palate is somewhat lighter in style, with the fruit not seeming to have fully ripened. Light smoke notes thread throughout.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Craftsman Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black-cherry aromas meet with light licorice and cocoa dust on the nose of this always reliable bottling. The palate is more dry in expression, offering rich cherry as well as toasted coconut flake and more licorice, with tannins slowly rising into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: True Myth 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Minty and herbal, this wine offers a spicy intensity of Old World style and complexity. Toasted oak underscores the foundation of sage and brambly berry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2015 Ranch House Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine made in a light, elegant style and priced fairly, this is likably approachable in concentrated red fruit, graphite and caramel, the oak toasted and restrained.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Logan Farrell 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Blended with 6% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec, this bold, generous wine is thick and structured in grippy tannin. A touch of reduction adds to the taste of tar, crushed rock and toasted oak, with an earthy element of cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of Satsuma orange fruit and oil, smoke, clove and plum. Plush, lightly smoky flavors follow, with a firm scaffolding of tannins providing support.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Adrice 2017 Riveter Red Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: A broad texture plus warm, ripe flavors of roasted plums and milk chocolate give this full-bodied wine an easy entry, while rather light tannins don't interrupt its smooth flow on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This fruity, juicy version of Cab is on the lighter side in terms of body, but it still has a deep color, creamy texture, moderate tannins and good varietal character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Carmel Road 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of Satsuma orange, smoke and spice lead to lighter-style flavors. The tannins give a light squeeze.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Structure 2018 Foundation Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Smoked wood, baked plum, grilled beef and crushed graphite aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's a tad dried-out on the palate, with ripe black plum, leather and a very oaky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: 13 Stripes 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of blackberry, eucalyptus and green tobacco feed into a plump palate with ample oak character. Minty berry flavors are herbal, slightly green and gritty, while this features grabby tannins that make the finish a bit sticky.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viñedos Marchigüe 2019 Santa Marta Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Estrella District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed slate, blackberry-jam, charred wood, dried oregano and leathery earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by chunky tannins, offering dusty earth, bitter herb and leathery flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vineyard Block Estate 2018 245 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Estrella District)

Description: With a nose of cola and dill, this vineyard-designate shows the 24 months it spent in all new French oak, grippy and thick on the palate in undulating waves of baked plum and cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pestoni Family 2017 Three Tears Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Description: Spicy, lightly green aromas of berry fruits and plum lead to a crisp and juicy palate with high acidity and raw tannins. Currant, tomato and red plum flavors are snappy, while this maintains some sharpness on a finish with pop and sizzle.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Santa Marta Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Viñedos Marchigüe 2019 Santa Marta Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This lively and attractive wine offers spicy cinnamon and vanilla aromas, and fairly rich fruit flavors of black plum and red cherry. Medium to full body and very light tannins help balance the richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Simple Life 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Raspberry, plum and cassis aromas are ripe but not overdone, while this Cabernet feels basic and fluffy on the palate. Medicinal cherry and plum flavors are backed by a finish with sticky tannins and hints of oxidation. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2019 Los Vascos Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This is a simple red aged in 50% new French oak that delivers flavors of dark cherry, blackberry and black currant. A hint of mocha adds richness to the core of supple tannin and soft approachability.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Great Bear 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine given 18 months in nearly all new French oak. Black olive, cherry and currant appear on the front of the thick, concentrated palate with a hint of anise and leather. The acidity takes on a sourness on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vine Cliff 2015 Private Stock 16 Rows Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of green garden and savory herb are followed by notes of plum, tangerine and whiffs of smoke. Easy-drinking black currant and smoke flavors follow.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Simply... 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Thick in sage, dried herb and dense black fruit, this wine is muscular and earthy in equal measure, big on the palate with a lingering taste of graphite.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chiron Wines 2016 Spring Theory Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Description: An experiment of 100% varietal wine in 85% French oak and 15% American oak, this wine does indeed show oak, and a bit of sweetness of vanilla and baking spice. Reductive, it is leathery and tannic with a grip of intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Peju 2017 The Experiment Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This rich and ripe wine layers milk-chocolate, sweet plum and strawberry flavors in a way that's inherently tasty but unusual for a Cabernet. It is soft in texture and full in body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Big Smooth 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Notes of wood smoke, black olives and black pepper dominate this full-bodied wine, revealing more oak than fruit flavors. A moderately tannic texture gives a hearty feel that matches the spicy flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Leese-Fitch 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: With 2% Syrah this is a soft, simple and highly ripe wine, barrel aged in French oak for 24 months. Iron, dried herb and sage highlight a core of jammy blackberry and cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Appellations Cellars 2015 CEO Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This full-bodied wine is extremely tight and tannic in texture, gripping its tart cherry and blueberry flavors tightly even after several extra years of bottle aging.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rosati Family 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Maple and candy-apple flavors coat this full-bodied, firm-textured wine, pretty much subduing its fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Aquinas 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Description: Lactic oak fosters a nose dominated by vanilla and milk chocolate aromas, while this feels creamy and grabby. Like the nose, this Cab tastes of vanilla and drugstore chocolate through the finish. Overall, this seems “worked” more than natural.                      Michael Schachner
Name: MontGras 2019 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Thick and savory, this wine is abundantly tannic and possessed of medicinal tones. The fruit is a mix of dark berry and black currant, with pronounced oak adding to the overall intensity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Appellations Cellars 2018 Wild and Free Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This soft, rich and somewhat sweet wine tastes like an after-dinner coffee drink. Not bad at all, but not what one expects from Cabernet Sauvignon.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Apothic 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Generic aromas and mild fruit flavors lead to an almost-sweet finish in this simple red wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three Thieves 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Blatant, smoky, charred-oak aromas and flavors dominate this medium-bodied wine, which adds a sweet vanilla touch on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Grayson 2019 Lot 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Eucalyptus oil dominates in this wine, making it disproportionately green and tannic on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kenwood 2016 Jack London Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)

Description: This dense and firm-textured wine offers tight black-cherry and clove flavors wrapped in full-blown tannins. It's difficult to know if time will improve it.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Orsa 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Description: A rusty color and green, underripe aromas of herbs, peppercorn and road tar set up a raw palate with little shape, concentration or elegance. Tomato and plum flavors lean herbal and saucy, and overall this Bolivian Cabernet Sauvignon is just barely cutting it.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Uvairenda 2017 1750 Cabernet Sauvignon (Bolivia)

Description: This is from the producer's organically farmed estate and blended with 7% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. A beautiful, elegant and youthful wine, it offers seamless texture and integration, quiet hints of blueberry and black currant and a hint of cocoa powder. Gentle in nature and approach, it has a complex depth and more to say. Enjoy best from 2027 through 2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Spottswoode 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Description: This is the first vintage of the Australian producer's foray into Napa Valley. It is tightly structured yet supple, bursting in bright currant and strawberry flavors. Savory components of sage, dried herb and black pepper dot the palate alongside silky tannins and chocolate-laced richness. A fresh touch of blood orange arises on the finish. Enjoy from 2028–2033.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 704 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: From a range of sites and expertly blended by Philippe Melka and his team, this wine has 5% Petit Verdot and spent 18 months in French oak, half of it new. Black olive, pencil shaving, sage and cedar provide a savory context against which concentrated black cherry and plum play. Coffee makes an appearance on the finish. Enjoy 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Lail 2018 Blueprint Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine is a blend of grapes from Napa Valley (85.1%) and South Australia (14.9%). A tannic structure gives way to a welcome juiciness of tangy cranberry and currant flavors. French and American oak aging impart a moderate level of toast and vanilla tones, with accents of cedar, dried herbs and black pepper chiming in. The bright acidity lasts through a long, supple finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 149 Cabernet Sauvignon (Global)

Description: From the producer's estate vineyard on the north-eastern side of the valley, this is an earthy, elegant and classically structured wine, 100% varietal and aged 22 months in entirely new French oak. Cedar, pencil shavings and cassis combine around a core of structured tannin and powerful length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2018 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Entirely varietal and given 22 months in 100% new French oak, this wine exudes dark mocha, black currant and cassis flavors, coming together in a seamless, opulent style. Sweet oak and notes of clove, cinnamon and black pepper dot a structured, complex and full-bodied wine of considerable length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2018 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: From the producer's mountainous estate, this is blended with 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. It displays the power of elevation, revealing dense layers of sage and black currant highlighted by cedar and graphite. Cellaring is recommended; enjoy from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: The inaugural release of this red combines 87% Cabernet Sauvignon with 13% Shiraz, using grapes from both Napa Valley and South Australia. Dark and brooding, it delivers a smooth, textured palate of bright red fruit and supple, integrated tannins, with meaty undertones along a continuum of black pepper, graphite and leather.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Penfolds 2018 Quantum Bin 98 Cabernet Sauvignon (Global)

Description: Earthy in compost, iron and graphite, this is a full-bodied and fully integrated wine with a remarkably elegant structure. Black currant and blackberry fruit components are richly layered throughout a core of supple tannin and lasting oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2018 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Made from an outstanding site in the eastern hills of the appellation, this wine is thick and concentrated in blackberry and mocha. Sage, dried herb and cedar contribute earthiness and complex varietal character, the tannins sturdy and strongly represented within the grippy intensity of the wine. Consider cellaring and enjoy best from 2028 through 2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Waypoint 2018 Oakville Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: This 100% varietal wine is made from Beckstoffer Heritage vineyards' fruit as well as the producer's own Cloudy's Vineyard. Juicy in black cherry and berry, with a hint of vanilla, it is powerfully built with underlying elegance and impressive integration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This 100% varietal wine is made from Beckstoffer Heritage vineyards' fruit as well as the producer's own Cloudy's Vineyard. Juicy in black cherry and berry, with a hint of vanilla, it is powerfully built with underlying elegance and impressive integration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with 13% Cabernet Franc, this beautifully styled wine is sourced primarily from the producer's estate vineyard on Moon Mountain.
