Sanguine, herbal and earthy, it dazzles in peppercorn, leather, cedar and gracefully structured tannins. Dark chocolate and plum add subtle richness as a note of crushed rock closes things out. Enjoy from 2025–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stone Edge Farm 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This excellent wine offers aromas of blueberry, currant, terra cotta, iodine, savory spices and an umami-like seaweed nuance. There's lovely depth of flavor, tannin structure and regional expression on the palate. Drink through 2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penley Estate 2019 Phoenix Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine that impresses from first sip. Softly layered and well integrated, it has broad, fresh and supple richness highlighted in cedar, dried herb, sage and dense red fruit. The length and breadth are breathtakingly memorable.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Jax 2018 Block 3 Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush aromas of black currant, plum skin, clove, star anise, lilac and loamy soil make for a very complex and layered nose in this bottling. Chiseled tannins frame a dynamic sip, where milk chocolate and star anise accent the rich cherry-compote and orange-rind flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rangeland 2016 Limestone Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)

Description: Soft and supple in dark chocolate, tree bark and rich layers of blue fruit, this powerfully built red is grippy and textured, with enviable length. Cedar, dried herb and sage make appearances along the way, adding to the complex sophistication of the palate. This big-boned wine could do with more aging; enjoy best 2028 through 2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Poetic Justice 2018 Lowrey Vineyard South View Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Creamy in texture and decadent in style, this reserve-worthy, 100%-varietal red is a mix of cherry cola and vanilla cream, lush and rounded with a length of baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Description: Soft and supple in dark chocolate, tree bark and rich layers of blue fruit, this powerfully built red is grippy and textured, with enviable length. Cedar, dried herb and sage make appearances along the way, adding to the complex sophistication of the palate. This big-boned wine could do with more aging; enjoy best 2028 through 2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Poetic Justice 2018 Lowrey Vineyard South View Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the estate's original 1.1-acre planting, this bottling begins with aromas of crushed rocks, dark boysenberry and light fennel on the nose. Firm and dry tannins frame the sip, where ripe berry paste flavors are cut by pencil shavings, turned earth, dried herb and more crushed rock.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sunstone 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Burly in juicy waves of black and red berry, this lengthy, complex and ripe wine is intense and powerfully built. Sage, crushed rock and firm tannins give it an edgy grip, lending a nice complement to the power. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Waypoint 2018 Lowrey Vineyard Basalt Ledge Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This traditional bottling opens with a deep well of rich, winter warming aromas: cassis, plum, chocolate, bay, eucalyptus, graphite, and peppery spices. The palate is rich and muscular but with restraint and a tang of fruit that offers much needed freshness. Tannins are broad-shouldered and dusty with myriad spices. Drink now with rare steak or roast mushrooms, or cellar until 2035, at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Château Tanunda 2017 50 Year Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This widely available bottling remains a very wise choice for the price point. Dark in the glass, it begins with cassis, pie crust and baking spice on the nose, yet there's a savory black-olive touch as well. Firm yet polished tannins carry dark fruit, cocoa and light licorice through the dense palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2018 Hilltop Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Thick and substantial on the palate, this 100% varietal wine was given time in 85% new French oak. Cranberry, red currant and dark cherry meet an earthy, well-integrated core of dried herb, graphite and sage.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Description: Earthy layers of tobacco, cedar and blackberry highlight this elegant wine. With integrated tannins and oak, it is a seamless red that speaks softly yet with an enduring presence.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Neyers 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This impressive red combines 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Petit Verdot, 8% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, nearly all hillside fruit. Together they offer a spicy, lively palate of brown spice, toasted oak and dark, brooding black fruit, integrated and structured to a complete finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Young 2016 Scion Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Dark chocolate, barrel spice, vanilla, cherry and licorice aromas are followed by luscious black fruit flavors. There's plenty of richness, texture and seamlessness along with a whole lot of structure. A long finish caps it off. It's all about hedonism, but still possesses impressive balance, a classically Woodward styled wine. The oak is forward at present. Give it some time in the cellar or decant. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2018 Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mocha, piercingly pure cherry, graphite and cedar box lead to a textured, graceful palate. The style is very pulled back and is all about elegance and grace. It brings a fine sense of acidity and tannin structure. Pair it with ratatouille. Best after 2025 with a very long life beyond that.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is savory and supple in well-integrated tannins. Black fruit, graphite and a robust mouthfeel make it powerful and complex, leading to a finish of baking spice that persists. This needs time in the cellar; enjoy from 2027–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Neyers 2017 AME Neyers Ranch Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Thick, leathery tannins support a core of full-bodied, opulent blue fruit in this grippy, robustly styled red. Baking spice, mocha, sage and oak support the varietal fruitiness and exuberant length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etude 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark black-cherry aromas meet with woody caramel, light leather and dusty oregano on the nose of this bottling. The palate pops with fresher fruit and dark flowers, as leathery tannins wrap up savory herb and sandalwood flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Joyce 2018 Old Vine Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)

Description: A woody, savory small-production wine, with notes of graphite around dense black fruit, this red offers substantial oak and tannin. It is also full bodied and structured within a complex context. Made entirely from one variety, it was aged 20 months in all new oak. It will do well with further cellaring; enjoy best from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Collinwood Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This big, complex and lavishly oaked wine offers abundant aromas of wood smoke, salt and pepper that expand to rich blackberry and black cherry on the palate accented by cedar and tobacco. Well integrated tannins and full body give the wine plenty of structure. Best through 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: Ripe, wood-aged and now just ready to drink, the wine has all the fruity character of Cabernet Sauvignon, black currants and intense acidity. That goes with the structure that is still in place while leaving plenty of room for the vibrant fruits. The wine, still full of fruitiness, is ready to drink but could certainly be held until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Quinta de Pancas Cabernet Sauvignon Special Selection
Name: Companhia das Quintas 2016 Quinta de Pancas Cabernet Sauvignon Special Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

Description: Earthy, tannic and young, this wine brims in black fruit, cedar and tobacco that are accented by black olive and crushed rock. With substantial midpalate weight, it takes time to integrate, finding a cohesive conclusion on the long finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Neyers 2017 Neyers Ranch Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Earthy, tannic and young, this wine brims in black fruit, cedar and tobacco that are accented by black olive and crushed rock. With substantial midpalate weight, it takes time to integrate, finding a cohesive conclusion on the long finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Neyers 2017 Neyers Ranch Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Thick, woody and savory in cedar, pencil shaving and sage, this wine is substantial in style and weight, with firm tannin and toasty oak. Rich layers of black fruit, tobacco and dark chocolate complement the earthy opening. This will do well with further aging; enjoy best from 2025–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Merryvale 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Sweet and tangy in cassis and dark cherry, this well-integrated wine is lengthy and relatively subdued, with an elegant structure. Dried herb, cedar and a note of tobacco round out the yin and yang of the wine.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from a newer site in the Rocky Reach region, with the grapes grown on granite bedrock soils—a rarity for Washington. It has classic Cabernet aromas of cherry, crushed herbs, currant, cedar and olive. The palate is medium-plus in feel, soft, reserved and understated. Bright acidity provides support. Give it some additional time in the cellar.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Rocky Pond 2017 Reserve Double D Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intensely woody aromas of dark cedar and mahogany morph into creamier baked fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is cohesive in flavors, with red cherry and brown spice all wrapped in firm tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of raspberry compote, coffee and spice. Plentiful cherry and black licorice flavors follow, with the lightly grainy tannins giving a squeeze. Coffee notes linger on the finish. This one needs time to be fully appreciated but has good stuffing.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2017 Winemaker's Select Lawrence Estate Wines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A black currant aroma is at the fore of this wine, followed by notes of spice and herb. There is a whole lot of depth and intensity to the dark fruit flavors. It's absolutely chock-full of fruit and structure.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Goose Ridge 2018 g3 Estate Grown Family Owned Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is a polished Cab that showcases Coonawarra's regional personality with characters like mint, blue and purple fruit and pencil shavings, all backed by chocolate, vanilla and toasty oak. There are bundles of tangy fruit in the mouth, wound by powerful, drying tannins and a spicy note to the finish. If drinking now, have protein and decanter at hand, or ideally wait until 2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hollick 2018 Ravenswood Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

Description: Thick and juicy in dense black fruit, the tannins of this wine are supple and well integrated, with a broad undercurrent of tingly acidity. Tree bark, tobacco and black olives dot the medium-bodied palate of firm, impressive structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cultivar 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is unmistakably Cabernet, with its aromas of black currant, spice and dark fruit. The palate brings seriousness uncommon to see at a wine at this price, rich through the middle with plenty of structure to back it up. A light medicinal streak runs in the background.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Be Human 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Packed with tasty chocolate, tobacco and baked plum flavors, this concentrated and full-bodied wine balances generous fruit flavors with supple, moderate tannins and attractive oak spices of vanilla and cedar.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Reserve Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-berry aromas meet with wet rocks and turned soil on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong sense of minerality to the palate as well, with crushed rock and earthy clay flavors as well as baked blackberry and light fennel spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2017 Lock Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Thick in earthy sage and oak, this wine includes 12% Merlot, 6% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. It was aged in French oak, 40% of it new. Full bodied and well integrated, it delivers bold flavors of waxy plum, baking spice and coffee bean.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Young 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Thick, concentrated layers of dark-red fruit are cradled in well-integrated oak and tannin in this mountain wine. Powerfully built, it offers opulent weight and lasting lushness, finding its groove on the long, clove-laden finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an appropriately named, attention-getting wine. The aromas draw you into the glass with notes of dried herbs, plum and black currant. The flavors are fresh and lively, with a lightly grainy feel to the tannins and pleasing depth of flavor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Headturner 2018 The Nerve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: Waxy plum, bark and sage ride along a throughput of thick tannin and integrated oak in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Varietally earthy and herbal, it offers good value for a high-quality experience of length and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Oakville Winery 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Earthy compost and dried herb notes complement a full-bodied exploration of oak and tannin that finds integration and elegance within the powerful framework of intensity. Dark cherry, red currant and a freshening note of orange peel combine well to offer refined flavor.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Description: Bursting in classic elements of red currant and cassis, this reserve-worthy wine is fresh in acidity and savory in dried herb, cedar and crushed rock. The oak and tannins are well integrated amid a full-bodied expression of concentrated length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reynoso 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very fresh in its lively color and lively aromas, this bottling offers black raspberry, cocoa and mint on the juicy, accessible nose. It hits the palate very dry, with blackberry and boysenberry flavors as well as mint, vanilla and cola spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2018 Bunkhouse Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This side project from the Oregon's Stoller focuses on some of the oldest vines in the Pacific Northwest, with this one coming from the first commercial plantings in the valley (1981). It leans into the variety's savory side, with aromas of fresh huckleberry, marionberry, nori, dark soil and whiffs of whole green pepper. The soft, supple flavors show sneaky intensity. It hangs on the finish. The oak is pulled back, letting the fruit shine. This is all about sophistication.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: History 2017 Windrow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: A 100% varietal wine made in a full-bodied, robustly thick and substantial style, this red offers firm, ample tannin and oak. Mocha, black currant and black cherry are hugely impactful in flavor (within the context of the body weight) and buzzy in acidity on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cakebread 2017 Benchland Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A classic Cabernet nose, this is medicinal and herbal, with notes of olive, currant and tobacco leaf. There's a cool winter berry vibe about it. Tannins are powerful, spicy and talc-like in texture, nicely weaving together the red fruit and acidity. A big wine for tannin lovers but one that maintains harmony.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hollick 2019 Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are mossy, with notes of asphalt, olive and even roasted nuts. The mouthfeel on this Cabernet is big and saturated but airtight in terms of structure. Ripe plum and cassis flavors are mildly spicy, while this is sappy and broad on the finish, with a note of char from toasty oak. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Mendel 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is still wound up tightly right now, with notes of toasty oak, herb and dark fruit. Blackberry and black cherry flavors follow. The tannins are tightly wound. There's a lot of goodness to be had. Give it a decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: 10,000 Hours 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: Soft and leathery on the palate, this understated wine is earthy and tangy in currant and cranberry. Firm tannins provide a subtle structure, with notes of cedar, pencil and clove lending balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Akrasia 2015 Line of Fire Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Paso Robles Highlands District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Serious aromas of black plum, leather, dried marjoram and cedar oil lead into a hearty palate, loaded with roasted plum, smoked meat, black olive and pine resin. Black pepper spice carries the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Wilkes 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Highlands District)

Description: Deeply concentrated in tangy black cherry and berry, this wine is perfumed and approachable, ready to enjoy and priced fairly for its fine quality. Clove, tobacco and vanilla oak round out the lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Silver Ghost 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with 10% Merlot, this is a delightfully balanced and elegant red wine, supple in red fruit and muted tannin. The structure offers integration and lifted acidity, the wine light in savory tones of earth and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Textbook 2017 Mise En Place Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong impact of herbs on the nose of this mountain bottling, along with iron shavings, dried shiitake, baked earth and an underlying sense of dried red fruit. Redwood spice shows on the palate, where dried cherry, leather and dusty herbs battle for attention.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Two Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: This wine isn't ready to reveal itself right now, with locked up aromas of chocolate, cocoa, cherry and spice. Coffee and cherry flavors follow. Give it some additional time in the cellar to blossom.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2018 Artist Series #27 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty, caramelized oak is prominent on the nose of this bottling, which also shows smoked cherry-compote and seasoning-salt scents. The oak drives the palate as well, where mesquite wraps up the baked red fruit, with lingering mocha and vanilla on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Clone 6 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Herbal in style, this aged red is leathery and powerful in oak and tannin. Black olive, nutmeg and blackberry combine around a hearty ripeness and lasting grip.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2016 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: Tangy currant and cranberry is complemented by earthy compost, cedar and crushed rock elements: a nice showcase for the appellation. Made in a thick, substantive style, it offers robust ripeness and hearty oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Description: This delicious and inviting wine is full in feel yet well balanced. Rich, fresh red- and black-cherry flavors are lightly spiced with mint, vanilla and cinnamon as velvety tannins soothe the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-cherry aromas meet with crumpled flowers and minty cocoa tones on the nose of this bottling, which includes 7% Syrah. Toast and red cherry are expected flavors on the palate, where there are also intriguing hints of red plum, tar, asphalt and charred meats. Vanilla hangs onto the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Angeles County)

Description: Thick, dusty tannin and oak give way to a powerful layering of rich red fruit in this full-bodied mountain-grown wine. Dark currant, cherry and cassis mingle around crushed rock, iron and enduring earthiness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reynoso 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Boysenberry and black currant are savory on the nose with subtle aromas of tea and white pepper. It's bright upfront on the palate with blackberry and crunchy cranberry flavors. There's plenty of tart acidity, and the midpalate slides into green tobacco leaves and oak tones before diving into a spicy and peppery finish developing more vanilla and black plum flavors.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Monticello)

Description: Thick, concentrated waves of dark brooding fruit rise from this warm-climate wine, the tannins sweet and lengthy. Toasted oak adds additional texture and a lasting note of vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Perfumed in red fruit, crushed rock and a note of sage, this big red is oak-driven and firm in lengthy, substantial tannin. Powerfully ripe and lush, it delivers velvety richness for days.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: Ripe plum and blackberry aromas come with hints of tar and fresh asphalt. A snappy mouthfeel based on healthy fruit is full but not ponderous, while this tastes of ripe blackberry and cassis that yield to prune in front of a well-formed finish with no loose edges. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luna de Finca la Anita 2017 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Agrelo)

Description: This wine is supple and richly layered, with a viscous, roundedness that emphasizes its plush, full-bodied style. Cedar, blackberry and sweet oak make it a likable expression of the grape that doesn't overthink things, delivering lasting notes of vanilla and chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2016 Six Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fruit-forward in notes of plum and black currant accented by baking spice. The flavors are ripe and luscious. Pleasing acidity ties it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: The Soldier 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Emphasizing a substantial body weight of red fruit, cedar and graphite, this is a hearty and considerably ripe wine, rich and deeply layered. Lingering oak adds a touch of vanilla and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Generations Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine is supple and richly layered, with a viscous, roundedness that emphasizes its plush, full-bodied style. Cedar, blackberry and sweet oak make it a likable expression of the grape that doesn't overthink things, delivering lasting notes of vanilla and chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sei Querce 2016 Six Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fruit-forward in notes of plum and black currant accented by baking spice. The flavors are ripe and luscious. Pleasing acidity ties it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: The Soldier 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Roasted coffee bean and dark chocolate aromas are upfront, with cherry behind. Lighter-styled vanilla and coffee flavors follow, with a pleasing sense of texture and balance. It's a restrained offering of the variety. The oak plays a prominent part in the show but plays it well.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2017 Lawrence Estate Wines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A spiciness of cinnamon Red Hots heats up a core of soft red fruit in this full-bodied, small-production, 100% varietal wine. Pillowy tannins surround an earthy complement of graphite, iron and rock.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Haggerty Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Santa Margarita Ranch, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, cola nut, iron shavings and clove show on the nose of this bottling, which is a new upper tier release for this brand. There's a strong cedar and sandalwood kick to the sip, where dark-plum, dried beef and soy flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ancient Peaks 2017 Pearl Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Margarita Ranch)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Red Mountain Cabernet at this price? Yes, please. Blackberry, dried herb and spice lead to palate-coating fruit flavors with plenty of structure. It shows impressive balance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chasing Rain 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Roasted coffee bean and dark chocolate aromas are upfront, with cherry behind. Lighter-styled vanilla and coffee flavors follow, with a pleasing sense of texture and balance. It's a restrained offering of the variety. The oak plays a prominent part in the show but plays it well.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2017 Lawrence Estate Wines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A spiciness of cinnamon Red Hots heats up a core of soft red fruit in this full-bodied, small-production, 100% varietal wine. Pillowy tannins surround an earthy complement of graphite, iron and rock.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Haggerty Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak leads on the aromas initially, with notes of vanilla in front of cherry and raspberry. The fruit flavors are bunched up right now, extending over time. It's a light, pretty offering of this variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pambrun 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Reductive and waxy on the palate, this wine has powerful concentration and tannin weight—substantial elements that make it robust and lengthy. Soft, lush and approachable, it has a wide appeal and roundness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Herbal and dusty, this cooler- climate red is 100% varietal and old school in nature. Leather, earth and a touch of barnyard give it a rustic edge around mellow layers of blueberry and plum.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stringer 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Herbal and dusty, this cooler- climate red is 100% varietal and old school in nature. Leather, earth and a touch of barnyard give it a rustic edge around mellow layers of blueberry and plum.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stringer 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

Description: A 100% varietal wine that spent 18 months in barrel, this shows a thickness of iron and tar and quite a bit of reduction, while still youthfully unwinding in the bottle. An intensity of mineral-like rock and tannin give it a powerful imprint.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Knights Bridge 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Jammy fruit aromas of strawberry and plum are cut by toasted wood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers purple-flower flavors and hints of mint and pine, with red and black plums providing the slight tart core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: AJA Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)

Description: This is a tannic, thick and deeply concentrated wine, robust in dried herb, jammy black cherry and cocoa powder. It packs a memorable punch, the savory earthiness providing contrast with subdued complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of dark roasted coffee bean, green pepper, dried herbs, orange rind and cherry. Sleek coffee and cherry flavors follow. Coffee notes linger on the finish. Like a number of wines from this vintage, the fruit concentration is light, but what's there is tasty.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Reserve Grand Klasse Lawrence Estate Wines
Name: Gård 2016 Reserve Grand Klasse Lawrence Estate Wines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Earthy plum and berry aromas start out cool, damp and spicy before turning mostly to toasty blackened oak. This hits hard with mouthcoating tannins, while toasty oak dominates a flavor profile filled out by standard blackberry and cassis. Fittingly, this is tough and pulling on an intense finish where a strong oak character persists.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Proemio 2018 Reserve Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Description: Reduced and undeniably earthy, this appellation wine tastes of cedar, pencil shaving and coffee. It is savory and tannic up front. Powerfully built, it ends in a strong jolt of oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: Graphite, rock and iron elements contribute an underlying earthiness to this intensely concentrated wine—a good representation of the appellation's warmth and richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: This wine starts with aromas of plum, dried cherry and spice. It offers rich flavors of blackberry, warming spice and a touch of mineral zing. Its full-bodied style calls for a bigger dish. Think grilled beef or game.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Tsantali 2017 Klima Klima Organic Cabernet Sauvignon (Halkidiki)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Polished aromas of smoked cherry, cocoa and dried mint show on the nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied on the palate, where strawberry-juice, purple-flower and dried herb flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2018 Elliot Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (San Diego County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasant aromas of black cherry and blackberry meet with hints of wood, dried herbs, asphalt and black olive on the nose of this bottling. Dark leather and roasted berry flavors show on the palate, where firm tannins lead into a tea-leaf and chocolate-brushed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sean Minor 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Tight and thick in tannins, this wine is concentrated in dust, sage and cedar highlights that ride along a palate of dense, chewy blackberry and cherry. The oak is pronounced and adds to the length and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Steamboat Winery 2017 The Antlers Cabernet Sauvignon (America)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berries, leather, red flowers, wood shavings and licorice show on the nose of this bottling. It lands very cleanly on the palate, offering baked blackberry, violet and milk chocolate dusted with oregano, marjoram and pine, as acid pops on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: One Stone 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blueberry and plum aromas announce themselves. Ripe, plush flavors follow. Herb notes linger on the finish. There's a pleasing sense of balance throughout. It's hard to pin down as Cabernet, but who cares?                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mercer Bros. 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: High-pitched in dried herb and cedar, this wine offers substantial tannin presence and an intensity of oaky spice. The midpalate is a rich layering of cassis and black cherry with secondary components of coconut and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Iron, sage and cedar lead the way to a midpalate of soft, supple richness and substantial ripeness in this appellation wine. Thick tannins wrap around the layered fruit, underlining the fistfuls of power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With this 100% varietal, aromas of gummy, cinnamon and cherry are followed by green pepper, vanilla and cherry flavors with a lightly grainy feel. Give a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Bergevin Lane 2016 Moonspell Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, loamy soil, incense and roasted meat aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It lands on the palate with clean red fruit and sharp acidity, as waves of pine and smoke ride slightly chunky tannins into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Broadside 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: From a vineyard high atop Howell Mountain, with small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this red is thick and densely built in mocha, sage and cedar. Rich layers of vanilla and milk chocolate give it a roundedness and soft, supple structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Calla Lily 2016 Ultimate Red Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon and a sizable amount of Cabernet Franc, this wine opens with inviting aromas of baking spice and blackberry, flavors that follow through on the dense, chewy palate. It is deeply rich in chocolate and vanilla notes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Steamboat Winery 2017 River Angler Cabernet Sauvignon (America)

Description: Blended with 14% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot, this red is soft, supple and approachable—a force of tar, leather and juicy red and black cherry. The oak imparts elements of tobacco, cinnamon and coconut.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stephen Vincent 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A fiery initial blast of alcohol and spicy berry and plum fruit settles on lightly green and herbal, sort of like mild eucalyptus. A midsize-plus palate is lean in the middle, while flavors of currant, cherry and green herbs finish with a touch of buttery oak.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Viña Cobos 2018 Felino Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Description: This focused but fruity Cabernet starts with aromas of cherry and raspberry, followed by fresh, bright red fruit flavors. Tobacco, vanilla and cedar give it some gravitas.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Zacharias 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Greece)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine explores the variety's greener, more savory side, with notes of stem, green and poblano peppers, flower, cocoa and cherry. There's plenty of density to the flavors. It might be too green for some tastes, but there are good things happening.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Marion-Field 2016 Toby Tylor Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Softly structured, this wine appeals in richly concentrated black cherry and plum. Supple and integrated, it has wide appeal in its approachability and lasting vanilla oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark aromas of Morello cherry, seared cedar and sarsaparilla show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by clean, slightly tense lines of roasted black cherry and purple flower, leaning a tad sweet but dried out by the tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Josh Cellars 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine doesn't seem to have fully settled in initially, with notes of asphalt, spice, cedar, cigar box and cherry cordial. Full-bodied fruit flavors follow, with all of the structure that this appellation brings. Time will tell if the aromas and palate sync up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Old Tavern Farm 2018 Big Barn Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight and brisk aromas of black raspberry meet with strong cedar and a touch of mint on the nose of this bottling. There's an herbal streak of oregano to the palate, where ripe berries, mushroom and tobacco flavors arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Porter & Plot 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This Napa Valley can is simple and approachable in blackberry and black cherry, with a mocha backdrop. Hearty and rich in style, it delivers smooth, velvety texture and likable hints of baking spice that overdelivers on its price.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pure Ugly 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly extracted aromas of black plum meet with lavender, sandalwood, soy and grilled meats on the savory nose of this bottling. Charred wood, dried fruit and beef-jerky flavors meet with a slightly bitter palo santo kick on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This Napa Valley can is simple and approachable in blackberry and black cherry, with a mocha backdrop. Hearty and rich in style, it delivers smooth, velvety texture and likable hints of baking spice that overdelivers on its price.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pure Ugly 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Earthy elements of dried herb, sage and cedar give this wine a green, herbal quality that outweighs the tangy fruit notes of currant and cranberry. The tannins are lengthy and help to emphasize the overall grip.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2018 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Solid plum and berry aromas set up a palate that's dry and a bit raw and rugged. Standard blackberry and dark plum flavors are touched up by light oak, while this Cabernet includes a note of spiced savory meat pie on a crisp finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light red-fruit aromas meet with darker mint, crumpled carnation and light oak on the nose of this bottling. There's a flash of sweetness at the tip of the sip before more complex tones of dark cherry and charred fennel arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: KIng Chancho 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Description: This ruby-hued Cab is initially soft and fruity, with bright cherry fruit, eucalyptus, tobacco leaf and an underbelly of peppery spice. The palate is on the lean and mean side, with shrill acidity that feels jarring after the eager charm of the nose. There are distinct Cabernet tannins, chalky, taut and spicy, and a purity of fruit, but not enough to add flesh to the bones.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hollick 2019 The Bard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal. The aromas are wound up tight, and the palate is grainy and gritty right now. The concentration seems light, as with many wines from this vintage, but the acidity is impressive. Some time should bring it all together. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pamplin 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Abundant black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill out this full-bodied and somewhat tannic wine. Its powerful structure supports dark-chocolate accents and a good sense of ripeness and roundness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rubino Estates Winery 2017 Riserva Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: This ruby-hued Cab is initially soft and fruity, with bright cherry fruit, eucalyptus, tobacco leaf and an underbelly of peppery spice. The palate is on the lean and mean side, with shrill acidity that feels jarring after the eager charm of the nose. There are distinct Cabernet tannins, chalky, taut and spicy, and a purity of fruit, but not enough to add flesh to the bones.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hollick 2019 The Bard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

Description: Thick and herbal, this wine is leathery thick and brimming in black cherry and graham cracker. The oak is well integrated and adds to the weight and richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trentadue La Storia 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried leather, black-plum and purple-flower aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a large helping of dried oregano and bay leaf on the palate, which also shows black-plum and incense flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is waxy and tannic on the palate, offering a sturdy, full-bodied and richly ripe expression of mountain sage, dusty rock and black cherry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Description: Packed with blackberry-jam and milk-chocolate flavors, this full-bodied wine is broad, rich and almost sweet on the palate. Full body and nicely integrated tannins make it mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 1924 2019 Double Black Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: This mature and spicy scented wine offers plenty of cinnamon, nut and vanilla aromas, followed by blackberry and blueberry flavors and a softly tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Appellations Cellars 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of brown and green stem, dried leaves, hay and plum followed by tart tobacco and hay flavors. The acidity of the vintage is primary. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kennedy Shah 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Description: Savory dark-berry aromas are spicy. Next, this is full and firm, with grabby tannins. Dark plum and black currant flavors are peppery and lightly herbal and finish with a note of grilled meat on a fiery finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: DiamAndes 2018 de Uco Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

Description: This ripe, flavorful and almost thick-textured wine is very deep in color, packed with jammy blackberry flavors and supported by moderate tannins. It's bold and full bodied.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three Finger Jack 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly extracted aromas of black plum meet with mahogany, incense and dark soil on the nose of this bottling. The blackberry-jam and licorice flavors of the palate are a bit rich.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Sacred Love Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Aromas of blackberry and plum are inviting on the nose. The palate displays juicy notes of cranberry and more blackberry. Tannins are gritty but balanced well by bouncy acidity leading to a long peppery finish laced with raspberry.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Casanel 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Middleburg)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, garden fresh herb, tar, dried black currant and black cherry lead to a palate that paints around the edges. There's brightness to the acidity, with the tannins giving a light squeeze.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kennedy Shah 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly minty aromas meet with strawberries, lilac, herbs and mushroom on the nose of this bottling. Black-plum-extract flavors meet with oregano and more mushroom on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: W. Paso 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This hyper-spicy wine is practically dripping with clove, cedar, vanilla and heavily toasted bread aromas, which are followed by almost-sweet milk-chocolate and cherry flavors. It is full bodied, firmly tannic and overtly oaky.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 7 Deadly 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, black-cherry, oregano and oak aromas show on the slightly tangy nose of this bottling. It's very grippy on the palate, where tangy, acid-drive black-plum-juice flavors meet with lots of herbal influence.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bottle Jack 2016 Zayante Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Ample cherry flavors are shaded by light smoke and herb notes. The medium-bodied palate is slightly tannic, with savory qualities typical of the grape.                      Jim Gordon
Name: CK Mondavi and Family 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wild herb and baked red-fruit aromas meet with black pepper on the nose of this bottling. Flavors of pencil shavings, dried herb and sour red fruits are almost bitter on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerland 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino County-Sonoma County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a good, well-made, straightforward and rather full-bodied wine that brings black olives to the aromas and black cherries to the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kenwood 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County-Sonoma County)

Description: The nose combines peppercorn, red plum and cherry notes. The wine is full of leather and tobacco flavors sharpened by tart pomegranate on the palate. It finishes spicy with prickling tannins hugging the tongue.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pearmund 2016 Silver Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

Description: Fiery berry fruit aromas include notes of cumin and other dried spices. This Cabernet is rough and rowdy, with broad tannins that clamp down hard. Black fruit flavors are spicy, roasted and oaky, with chocolaty leftovers on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Profesión 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

Description: Smooth and dusty, this wine is on the downside of its peak, is thick in tannin and elusive in black fruit and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: This smooth and straightforward wine offers mild blueberry and baking-spice flavors, light tannins and medium body.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 689 Cellars 2018 Lucky Draw Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Braised green pepper and black cherry aromas are followed by soft fruit flavors that bring a sense of elegance. Dried orange rind notes linger on the finish. The fruit seems quite underripe.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stemilt Creek 2017 Thomas Cycle Mathison Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This opens with intense notes of overripe berry on the nose. The palate is pure cotton candy and blue raspberry hard candy carrying through the finish where it's met by a hint of vanilla.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2018 John Arundell Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

Description: Murky aromas of earthy plum and dried leaf are a bit muddled. This Patagonian Cab is edgy and choppy in feel, with raw tannins. Plum and berry flavors are medium ripe, while this tastes a touch stalky on a finish that feels thick and grapy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Malma 2018 Finca La Papay Cabernet Sauvignon (Patagonia)

Description: An aroma of freshly sawn wood leads to very oaky, vanilla and cedar flavors in this heavily spiced, medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 689 Cellars 2018 Submission Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This sturdy, firm-textured, moderately tannic wine offers low-key fruit flavors dominated by slightly earthy, iron and black olive notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hobo 2018 The Way Back Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Aromas of black currant and blackberry lead to raspberry and herbs on the palate. Bright acidity keeps this pleasant enough and easily sippable.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Vint Hill 2017 Covert Wineworks Bombshell Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

Description: Modest ripeness on the nose is confirmed and amplified on a strict, punchy palate. Spicy red fruit flavors of currant and sour plum show a peppery green element prior to a tight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Funckenhausen 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Description: Skimpy red fruit aromas open this hard and tannic Cab with little depth. Dry flavors of plum skins and tomato are backed by a scrubbing finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca La Escondida 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: Given 32 months in 100% new French oak, this is a tremendously structured, perfumed and intensely powerful wine from the producer's famous estate. Full-figured and richly woven in blueberry and cassis, it shows remarkable earthiness in the form of sage, dried herb, lavender and crushed rock, with silky tannins encasing it all and a finishing touch of dark chocolate. Enjoy best from 2026 through 2036.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Shafer 2016 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Lively and fresh with a backbone of elegant, understated power, this 100% varietal wine is incredibly well made and reflective of its high-elevation, windswept site. Crushed rock, iron and earth surround a balanced midpalate of crisp red cherry, raspberry and currant, finishing in a cohesive dash of peppery clove and nutmeg. Enjoy now with a decant or cellar and enjoy best from 2025–2028.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Di Costanzo 2018 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: From the historic site in the cooler-climate appellation, this is an outstanding, elegant and complex 100% varietal wine. Leather accents a core of savory, edgy black fruit as secondary notes of tobacco, clove and cedar build. This wine is impressively earthy, Old World and remarkably polished.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Di Costanzo 2018 Caldwell Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Description: Powerfully broad-shouldered, this wine is soft and supple on the palate, with a fleshy quality that appeals. Earthy clove, cedar and pencil shavings provide a savory context against which elements of red and black currant, cassis and oak get to play. The structure of this wine will support cellaring; enjoy best from 2025 through 2028.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Di Costanzo 2018 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Description: A strong showing of black cherry and licorice lead the way to a soft, supple midpalate in this wine that's aged in French oak, half new and half once-used. Secondary notes of nutmeg, clove and coffee permeate through the structure and weight of the palate. Enjoy from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 John C. Sullenger Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Thick and concentrated in dense layers of cedar, pencil shaving and currant, this reserve-worthy wine is substantial in body wight and power, with considerable oak impact, as it was aged 20 months in 80% new French oak. Still, it shows remarkable underlying beauty, complexity and structure. It is a blockbuster that will do well in the cellar. Enjoy best from 2027 through 2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2017 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep in flavor, exceptionally well balanced and well polished, this sleek wine delivers power with grace. It shows great concentration in the black-currant and dark-chocolate flavors that are wrapped in silky tannins for an almost delicate presence on the palate. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mia Nipote Winery 2017 Lencioni Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: This memorable Cabernet Sauvignon has small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec blended in. Aged 17 months in a majority of new French oak, it unfurls flavors of red fruit, dried herb and clove over a core of youthful tannin and spicy oak. Best from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Far Niente 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Dry, spicy and tannic, with toasted oak notes, this is demure and graceful in structure. An earthy, herbal undercurrent and dark, brooding black fruit, crushed rock and tobacco leaf drive this wine that's sourced from four appellations within the valley. It's approachable now, but will hold well through 2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: La Pelle 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Among the producer's crown jewels, this site is historic and rightly coveted. It yields a delicious blockbuster of black cherry and currant flavors studded in layers of cedar, baking spice and gravel. The lengthy palate builds in power and structure as it goes on. Enjoy from 2028–2038.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 Martin Stelling Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Thick in sage brush, dried herb and earth, this wine is powerfully built and unabashedly ripe. Dark black fruit, mocha and graphite notes arise along the thick, intense palate, leading to finishing touches of slate and iron. Cellaring will help to tame the tannins; enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Waypoint 2018 Beckstoffer Georges III Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: Winemaker Kirk Venge crafts a well-made, varietally correct representation of the mountain site in this wine, which is brimming in cedar, pencil-shaving and peppercorn aromas. Crushed rock and iron notes highlight the soft, rich midpalate of dark cherry, currant and cassis. This powerful wine is a study in both length and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Entrepreneur 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: From the famous site, this high-end red opens in mocha, cassis and vibrant red cherry. Effusive and well-integrated, it develops a midpalate of earthy sage, graphite, tar and leather that provide savory complexity. The grip of tannin and oak suggest further cellaring. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Blind Justice Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard
Name: Justice 2018 Blind Justice Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of dark plum, berry, smoke, graphite, dried herbs and mountain woods show on the nose of this bottling by Colin McNany. Sandy tannins frame the sip, where mahogany, roasted plum, iron shavings and cocoa show in a savory display. Drink 2022–2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: La Honda Winery 2018 Salinian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: This small-production estate wine was aged two-and-a-half years in new French oak. With a luxurious body of opulent red fruit, it offers concentration and structure alongside hints of coconut and vanilla. Clove, black pepper and toasted oak add to the nuance of savory, earthy tones. Enjoy 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Tierra Roja 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a revelatory streak to this bottling, in that it shows how Cabernet Sauvignon can be presented in a very light yet very compelling manner. Elegant aromas of crumpled rose, carnation, dried strawberry and crushed rock lead into a delicate, restrained palate that remains tense while delivering a range of red fruit with dried oregano and marjoram.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Verdad 2017 Pine Hawk Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This tiny southern Oregon winery shows a real knack for Cabernet. This is smooth and lush, with a patina of chocolate over bright and spicy raspberry and cherry fruit. The fruit is so rich and ripe it borders on jam as it takes a deep dive down the palate and through a long finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Talent 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oregon)

Description: This tiny southern Oregon winery shows a real knack for Cabernet. This is smooth and lush, with a patina of chocolate over bright and spicy raspberry and cherry fruit. The fruit is so rich and ripe it borders on jam as it takes a deep dive down the palate and through a long finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Talent 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oregon)

Description: This memorable, inviting wine is herbal and earthy, with a soft lushness on the palate. Blackberry, currant and black cherry mingle with ease, accented by toasted oak and clove. This full-bodied red holds its power and concentration with lasting elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 Hayne Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Description: Soft, juicy waves of black cherry, cassis and a rich hint of marshmallow lead the way to an integrated and powerfully concentrated experience of richness in this impressive wine, its density lifted by the freshness of the fruit. Toasted oak and vanilla accent the long finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Entrepreneur 2016 360 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: This ageworthy wine grown at 1,400-feet elevation is dark in color, dense in flavor and braced by plenty of firm, chewy tannins. It is well packed with vivid black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors, very firm in the middle but also polished around the edges. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marietta Cellars 2017 Game Trail Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: With 13% Petit Verdot, this full-bodied wine is thick in tannin and concentrated layers of dusty currant, blueberry and mocha. Substantial in both weight and breadth, it coats the palate in toasted oak and a touch of dried herb, leading to an equally powerful finish. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2027 through 2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sullivan 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: This wine presents outstanding value for the quality. It is a 100% varietal wine that is enjoyable and complex on opening. Structured, earthy and savory in clove, leather and oak, it builds to a midpalate of sage, coffee and currant, remaining balanced in both ripeness and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Di Costanzo 2018 DI CO Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked oak, charred meat, dried oregano, soy and black-olive aromas make for a very dry and savory nose on this bottling. Leathery tannins surround smoked berry and roasted beef flavors on the palate, where peppercorns and shiitake-dust flavors linger long on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Integrity 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rare 100% varietal offering from this vineyard, the aromas offer notes of raspberry compote, red plum and Twizzler. A plump, rounded palate follows, showing depth but also grace. There's plenty of acid structure to stand it all up. It's outright delicious, winning on grace rather than sheer power.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2018 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Description: This thickly concentrated wine is brimming in leather and dried herb tones. Black fruit dominates and broods along the rounded, velvety palate, offering luxury and complexity in equal measure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 State Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

Description: A chewy grip of leather, tobacco and black currant highlight this robust, full-bodied red. Structured and cohesive, it retains an enduring richness of vanilla and oak amidst more complex elements of graphite and crushed rock. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Waypoint 2018 Lowrey Vineyard Homestead Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of black plum, mahogany, dried lilac and light pepper showcase the region's classic mountain style in this bottling, which comes from head-trained vines planted in shale. The palate combines that dry wood tone with rocky, baked soils and dark, dry fruits, with a slight acidic tang. Drink 2022–2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino 2017 Peter Martin Ray Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a hedonistic bottling sure to satisfy lush wine lovers, thanks to 22 months on 75% new French oak. Aromas of black cherry, cola, vanilla and fudge lead into a creamy palate of kirsch and caramel cappuccino, with well-integrated acidity and polished tannins as the frame.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hearst Ranch 2017 Proprietor's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of black plum, mahogany, dried lilac and light pepper showcase the region's classic mountain style in this bottling, which comes from head-trained vines planted in shale. The palate combines that dry wood tone with rocky, baked soils and dark, dry fruits, with a slight acidic tang. Drink 2022–2037.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino 2017 Peter Martin Ray Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beautiful, precise and complex fruit flavors make this wine a joy to sniff and sip. A luxurious texture of melted tannins wraps around black-currant, black-cherry and toasted oak notes in a seamless way. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steven Kent 2017 Ghielmetti Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: The toasted oak adds a note of salt to the gravelly texture of this 100% varietal wine. It is tight and youthful in tannin and weight. As it unwinds in the glass, it reveals a structured plushness of rich black cherry and currant.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 C.C. Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Big and saturated, this brawny but balanced wine overflows with well-matched oak spices and impressively ripe black-fruit flavors. Cedar, cinnamon and nutmeg are followed by blackberry and black cherry that ride the velvety tannins into a lingering finish. It's best through at least 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hawk and Horse Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)

Description: This rich wine is made from organically grown estate grapes. Plum, wax and mocha flavors combine around a robust midpalate of full-bodied density while the tannins remain supple and smooth. A touch of vanilla bean closes it out.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2016 V Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is hillside Cabernet blended with 5% Petit Verdot. It's a hearty, full-bodied expression of concentrated dark-cherry, cassis and blackberry richness and ripeness. Mocha, cedar and toasted oak combine to complement and contrast.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Young 2016 Silas Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Great structure and highly focused fruit flavors set this wine up for a potentially long life. It has amazingly pure flavors of black cherry and currant, firm tannins and a lingering finish. Enjoyable now with a grilled lamb chop, but it will be best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Big Shot Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bold, dense and rich, this full-bodied wine comes on strong in the aromas, offering concentrated black fruits, mint and vanilla, and expands on the palate. It wraps cherries and dark chocolate in plenty of fine-grained tannins. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Vista 2018 Russian River Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-berry, black-plum, light herb, loamy soil and earthy, smoked wood aromas come through on the nose of this special bottling. It's a very intellectual wine on the palate, combining sour plum fruit with earth, woody tones of mahogany, soy and oak, all leveled by pinpoint acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ridge 2017 Klein Monte Bello Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine from the producer's hillsides, which opens in currant, clove and nutmeg. Chocolate shavings and brooding red fruit accent a soft, structured core of sweet, integrated tannin and robust oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Young 2016 Thomas Meek Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of black raspberry, baked boysenberry, violet, baked earth and a hint of meat show on the nose of this bottling of clone 337. Lavender flavors add a floral tone to the palate, where the fresh but dark-fruit flavors are lifted by white-pepper spice and finish on vanilla.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: TW Ferm Co. 2016 Straight Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This powerful and concentrated wine is holding its fruit flavors tightly in a great structure of full body and firm tannins, while hints of vanilla, cedar and black currant show where it's going with time. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wood Family Vineyards 2018 Woody's Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Noticeably richer and more concentrated than the winery's Estate Selection Cabernet Sauvignon, this old-vine beauty delves into dense dark cherry and black currant mixed with accents of mentholated tobacco, truffle and crushed black pepper. There's weight, power and intensity to the medium-bodied palate, giving this the drive to hold well in the cellar. Drink through 2030.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2013 Old Vines Unfined Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Woody, earthy aromas of dried shiitake mushrooms, dark flowers, elderberry and pepper show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 12% Merlot and 8% Malbec. The palate is very much aligned with the region's savory style, with an oaky, woody backbone holding up the freshly smashed boysenberry, elderberry and dark-spice flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bottle Jack 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry, kirsch and assorted barrel spices carry the nose. The plum and dark fruit flavors are plush on the palate, with density, layering and richness, but there's plenty of acidity and tannic structure to tie it all together. Blackberry notes linger on the finish. The tannins bring some grip right now. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Goose Ridge 2018 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: From the producer's dry-farmed estate, the grapes for this wine are grown at 1,800-feet in elevation. Dried herb, black pepper and clove arise on the nose. The elegant, restrained palate brings notes of forest floor, red currant and cigar, all wrapped in a mountainous tannic structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Smith-Madrone 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Description: Blended with Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, this full-bodied, highly expressive red is made from Coombsville estate grapes as well as grapes from sites in Rutherford and Oakville. It presents concentrated, burly black-fruit notes tempered by savory clove, espresso, leather and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Faust 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Concentrated black fruit and thick tannins embody this wine that comes from a site overlooking Lake Hennessey. Cedar and dried herb add complexity and a savory character, which contribute to a lengthy finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 Element 28 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Blended with Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, this full-bodied, highly expressive red is made from Coombsville estate grapes as well as grapes from sites in Rutherford and Oakville. It presents concentrated, burly black-fruit notes tempered by savory clove, espresso, leather and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Faust 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Spring Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: From the producer's dry-farmed estate, the grapes for this wine are grown at 1,800-feet in elevation. Dried herb, black pepper and clove arise on the nose. The elegant, restrained palate brings notes of forest floor, red currant and cigar, all wrapped in a mountainous tannic structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Smith-Madrone 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This deep and concentrated wine combines dark, brooding black-plum, licorice and cooked cherry flavors on a richly tannic texture, lacing them with cedar, earth and tobacco nuances. Best through 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's wound up out of the gate, with aromas of spice, dark chocolate and cherry. Opulent cherry flavors follow but there's plenty of balance to them. Some green notes linger on the finish. It needs time to show its best. Enjoy after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Woodward Canyon 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: From a vineyard owned by Bart and Daphne Araujo, this is a small-production red brimming in cassis, red currant and dark cherry, that is dusty and oaky, with a note of leather. Full bodied and richly round, it shows off the appellation well, finishing in welcome accents of nutmeg and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Emerson Brown 2017 Rancho Pequeno Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A mixture of old block Bacchus (62%) and Dionysus vineyards, this 100% varietal wine was aged in 75% new oak. The barrel notes are still primary on this young wine at present, with notes of vanilla, cigar box and nougat. Over time they give way to cherry, The palate shows a lot of grace and polish, commanding as the name suggests but far from a big bruiser.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2018 The General Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This imposing wine blended from Sonoma and Mendocino county grapes offers great concentration and depth, a firm structure and a nicely polished texture that's still a bit tight with tannin. Delicious black-cherry and black-currant flavors are wrapped in velvety tannins that slowly reveal dried herb and black-olive undertones. Best from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marietta Cellars 2017 Armé Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of apple, dusty earth, bittersweet chocolate, green herb and cigar box. The flavors are pleasingly reserved, bringing a sense of polish, class and freshness. There's sneaky density to the fruit. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2017 Estate Grown Derby Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Juicy black and blue fruit meet a swath of rich dark chocolate in this well-made wine, with the tannins nicely soft and resolved. Hearty in style, it retains savory, earthy components of cedar and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stewart 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Out of the blocks, this Cabernet from a difficult rain-plagued vintage feels sharp and angular. Bright acidity and raw tannins continue a theme of ruggedness, but it's filled out by flavors of blackberry, chocolate and herbs. While this is tough and prickly, it shows a lot of what makes Maipo Valley Cabernet highly regarded. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Domus Aurea 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Description: From the folks at Odette and Plumpjack, this lovely red is juicy, broad and immensely likable, with soft layers of baking spice, black cherry and licorice. With 16% Merlot and smaller additions of Malbec and Petite Sirah, it delivers supple texture and length without fuss.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Adaptation 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of berry, black plum and herbs meet spice on the nose. An exuberant palate delivers flavors of berry, dark plum and pepper backed by a coffee note.
