Heat and pushiness on the finish confirm that this Cabernet is neither meek nor weak. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tagua Tagua 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

Description: From the folks at Odette and Plumpjack, this lovely red is juicy, broad and immensely likable, with soft layers of baking spice, black cherry and licorice. With 16% Merlot and smaller additions of Malbec and Petite Sirah, it delivers supple texture and length without fuss.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Adaptation 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Aromas of berry, black plum and herbs meet spice on the nose. An exuberant palate delivers flavors of berry, dark plum and pepper backed by a coffee note. Heat and pushiness on the finish confirm that this Cabernet is neither meek nor weak. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Tagua Tagua 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)

Description: Juicy and lengthy in sharp red fruit, this wine also shows a wealth of clove and black pepper, giving it a savory, spicy side. Well-integrated oak and tannin underscore its full-bodied power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Havens 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Description: Inviting dark-berry fruit is cradled in toasted oak in this thick, full-bodied and intensely flavored red made in small quantities. Baking spice and clove accent the brooding fruit and rich notes of dark chocolate, leading to a cohesive, satisfying finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Z. Alexander Brown 2015 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Locked up tightly out of the gate, cocoa, plum, green pepper and dried herb aromas emerge over time. Focused, soft black currant flavors follow. The appeal is as much about feel as flavor.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Basel Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas aren't ready to express themselves initially, with notes of fresh herb, black currant and plum. The flavors, on the other hand, are in full bloom, palate coating and velvety, with the enjoyment equal parts feel and flavor. It's made in a very approachable style but will do will with some time in the cellar as well.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Nelms Road 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of café au lait and cocoa powder are followed by notes of freshly chopped herb and cherry. Big, bold but still in check fruit flavors follow, with plentiful spice accents throughout. Coffee notes linger on the long finish.It shows rare balance for a wine at this price.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lydian 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from 1972 plantings at this esteemed vineyard, brooding aromas of savory herb, green pepper and bittersweet chocolate are followed by flavors that show pleasing elegance and nuance. It's a very pretty offering of the variety, with a fine sense of acid and tannin structure.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2017 Sagemoor Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Black olive, rock and black currant highlight this wine's deeply concentrated core of grippy tannins. Toasted oak accents of clove and vanilla round out the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Rodney Strong 2016 Brothers Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep black-plum and blackberry aromas make for a brooding yet quiet nose in this bottling, which also shows savory tobacco leaf and mahogany scents. Roasted plum, lilac and violet flavors kick off the full-bodied palate, which is undercut by soy and more tobacco.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Flood Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Evoking notions of blueberry coffee crumble, this wine is thick and grippy in tannin and robust weight, with a breadth of dark mocha and dried herb. Ripe and fruity beneath a foundation of structure, it would do well to cellar further. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Justice 2018 Jurisdiction Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine that was whole-cluster fermented and given 25 months in entirely French oak, this opens in black pepper, cedar and pencil shavings, inviting one in to a soft midpalate of thick, silky tannin. The oak is pronounced but complementary, adding baking spice and vanilla to the cassis fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Katali Wines 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Description: Evoking notions of blueberry coffee crumble, this wine is thick and grippy in tannin and robust weight, with a breadth of dark mocha and dried herb. Ripe and fruity beneath a foundation of structure, it would do well to cellar further. Enjoy from 2028–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Justice 2018 Jurisdiction Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine that was whole-cluster fermented and given 25 months in entirely French oak, this opens in black pepper, cedar and pencil shavings, inviting one in to a soft midpalate of thick, silky tannin. The oak is pronounced but complementary, adding baking spice and vanilla to the cassis fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Katali Wines 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Description: Seductive oak spices and a rich, mouthfilling texture give this full-bodied wine a lot to like. Moderate tannins support generous black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors, while vanilla, cinnamon and cedar complete the mix.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Klinker Brick 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Luxurious oak shadings dress this deeply fruity and full-bodied wine in baking spices, cedar and mint for a posh, international style. Firm tannins and very good concentration will help it improve through at least 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McNab Ridge 2017 Family Reserve Largo Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A project from actor Kyle MacLachlin, this is the winery's first Walla Walla Valley designated wine. The aromas bring notes of butterscotch, vanilla, cherry, baking spice and dried herb. Opulent, fleshy feeling flavors follow. It lingers on the finish, with fruit and barrel playing equal parts—a thoroughly enchanting wine. The acid of the vintage ties it all together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pursued by Bear 2017 Twin Bear Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This is a deeply powerful, thickly concentrated wine, given 30 months in French oak barrels, 30% of them new. From vineyards in the Howell Mountain and Glass Mountain area, it offers sultry cassis and blueberry flavors, the tannins refined and acidity refreshing.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Rich, layered and handsomely spicy, this full-bodied wine is a feast for the senses. Aged in American oak, it wafts mellow, complex cedar, tobacco and cinnamon aromas followed by concentrated blackberry, blueberry and charcoal flavors held firmly by fine-grained tannins. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2017 Thirty Eight Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Jahant)

Description: This wine shows off the appellation well; its rich red fruit is evocative of the fertile valley floor soils. A sweet nose of cherry and vanilla highlight a ripe, velvety opulence that's luscious and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pine Ridge 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: With lifted acidity, this wine takes on a mineral aspect of crushed rock and iron, the tannins substantial in weight and force. Textured, the wine is robustly ripe in black cherry, plum and currant, with a note of dill that lingers from the oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Black Stallion 2017 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: This is a robust, full-bodied wine from the appellation, a deft showcase of deep, dark-cherry fruit that is succulent on the palate. Spicy clove, black pepper and tobacco are along for the ride, seasoning a long finish of toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Black Stallion 2017 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Opening with cherry and vanilla notes, this wine is high-toned and elegant in style, with thick tannin weight providing structure and definition. Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot, Malbec and Merlot, it shows a wealth of dried herb, toasted oak and cassis as it builds.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gamble Family Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a soft, supple wine made in relatively large quantities that delivers a density of black and red currant, clove and tobacco. With small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, it is cohesive on the palate with tension and texture and a lasting note of oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sequoia Grove 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a soft, supple wine made in relatively large quantities that delivers a density of black and red currant, clove and tobacco. With small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, it is cohesive on the palate with tension and texture and a lasting note of oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sequoia Grove 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A bright opening of soft, integrated tannin leads to a core of thick, weighty red fruit and mineral notes in this red, which is blended with 7% Petite Sirah. Powerfully built, it has richness and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stringer 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This wine shows off the appellation well; its rich red fruit is evocative of the fertile valley floor soils. A sweet nose of cherry and vanilla highlight a ripe, velvety opulence that's luscious and lengthy.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pine Ridge 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very much showcasing the savory, woody mountain style of the region, this bottling begins with aromas of red and black berries, seared oak, crumpled rose petals and strong sandalwood tones. Dried wood-spice flavors of cedar and mahogany wrap the palate, where light plum-sauce and pepper-spice elements converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eden Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all Cabernet, with a healthy amount (25%) coming from esteemed Red Willow and the Dionysus fruit coming from block D14. The aromas bring notes of cocoa, dried and cherry. There's a lovely sense of brightness and deftness to the cherry and cocoa flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Kerloo 2018 Dionysus Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Heady aromas of dried cherry, fruity strawberry, light tobacco and pleasant herbs show on the nose of this bottling from Malibu. Fresh fruit flavors of roasted strawberry and plum are dusted with oregano, marjoram and pepper on the palate, which finishes on a tea-leaf kick.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Calayas 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Zinfandel, this is as hearty and full bodied as one might expect from the producer. Chewy in currant, cassis and savory earth, it is richly woven and layered with an unctuous quality to its big-boned, hearty style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Prisoner 2018 Cuttings Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Focused aromas of black plum, dried violet, soy and blood show on the slightly subdued nose of this bottling. There is more action on the palate, where savory beef-jerky and soy flavors meet with tart black-plum elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)

Description: Lushly textured, this smooth, approachable red wine is balanced and bright, with understated elegance and restraint. Presenting good value, it offers layers of cassis, black cherry and toasted oak seasoned in dried herb and a lasting hint of clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flora Springs 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Soft on the palate in mineral and dried herb, this is a lengthy, structured and sizably tannic wine. It bursts in flavors of mixed berries on the full-bodied palate, with lingering elements of nutmeg and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Nickel & Nickel 2018 Kenefick Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Inviting mint and pine aromas lead to a grippy palate of blackberry and tart cherry backed by firm tannins and full body. This wine from a Livermore Valley stalwart displays some of the oak spices like cinnamon and nutmeg that pair well with concentrated fruit notes. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Page Mill Winery 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Description: From an estate-grown hillside that produced 100% varietal grapes, this full-bodied red is concentrated and intensely layered, with a thickness of mocha, dark-cherry jam and raspberry. Earthy and herbal, it traffics in black pepper, leather and clove with ease.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Robert Young 2016 Bob's Burn Pile Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Ripe and nicely mature, this full-bodied wine offers almost-sweet maple-syrup and brown-sugar aromas, and on the palate and blends them with intricate, nuanced baking spices and mulled fruit flavors. It is a rich-tasting wine that could almost substitute for a Port.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McNab Ridge 2017 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Description: French oak-aged, this 100% varietal wine is thick, reductive and concentrated in dark fruit, espresso bean and toasted oak. Secondary accents of cedar and pencil shaving provide a savory contrast and complexity, the tannins pillowy soft.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Meyer Family Cellars 2017 Fluffy Billows Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from the Horse Heaven Hills. Blended with 25% Malbec, Cabernet's more savory side is on display initially, with notes of savory herb, green pepper, blood orange and plum. Plum and blue fruit flavors follow. There is great stuffing, but it needs some additional time to settle into the bottle. Best after 2021.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gorman 2019 The Devil Makes Three Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Opulent black-fruit flavors are well matched by mint, chocolate and cedar accents in this full-bodied, velvet-textured wine. Layered and mouthfilling, it offers abundant soft tannins to keep it appetizing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2018 Juggernaut Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This rich and inviting wine offers delicious black-cherry and black-plum flavors, a suave texture of fine-grained tannins and light oak accents of vanilla and cinnamon.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tiger Lily 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

Description: Reductive at first, this bold, concentrated estate-grown wine opens slowly, unfurling layers of dense blackberry and black-cherry flavors. Iron, crushed rock and powerful tannins add to the complexity, with a dash of nutmeg at the end.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2016 Las Flores Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's plenty of interest on the aromas, with notes of cedar, mushroom, raspberry, coffee and anise. Light, fresh, juicy flavors follow. The tannins give a light squeeze. It puts a premium on elegance, with the fruit pulled back. There's a surprising amount of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2017 Vineyard Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This mellow, smooth and drinkable wine is already showing the benefits of aging in its supple texture, subdued baking spices and broad mulled-fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A bit high-toned at first, eventually this shows a dense core of black cherry, menthol and crushed pepper on the nose. It's suave and silken on the palate, with polished tannins and tangy berry fruit that linger gracefully.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Potent aromas of green herbs, tobacco, spice, dried leaf and eucalyptus crowd out berry fruit scents. On the palate, this is tight and juicy but not generous. Spicy, herbal berry fruit flavors are lightly green and minty, while this holds onto a pyrazine-driven character on a tight finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Tutunjian 2015 Single Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)

Description: Aromas of cassis, menthol, sun baked earth and French oak mingle together in the glass. The monolithic, densely concentrated palate delivers oak-driven spice, coconut, steeped prune and licorice alongside grainy, drying tannins. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol that throws it slightly off balance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Tenuta Regaleali Vigna San Francesco Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

Description: Full bodied and smartly oaky, this complex and spicy-tasting wine offers rich blackberry and blueberry flavors laced with prominent oak notes of grilled baguette, cardamom and cinnamon. Moderate tannins help keep it in balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Head 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: A 100% varietal wine, this shows a crisp opening of red currant and cranberry flavor, bright and lengthy within a full-bodied, concentrated breadth of force. Succulent tannins provide a simple structure that keeps the wine balanced against the ripeness and oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: City Winery Hudson Valley 2017 Bettinelli Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

Description: Effusive dark-fruit and black-licorice flavors fill up this full-bodied and moderately tannic wine while ample oak accents of vanilla and toast add tasty complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael David 2018 Freakshow Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bold and spicy wine is laced with lavish oak nuances of cedar, clove, toast and mint that thoroughly coat the blackberry and black-cherry flavors. It is quite ripe and rounded but well backed by moderate tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Vista 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

Description: This rich, smooth wine is quite complete, well balanced and delicious. It wraps blackberry and raspberry flavors in mild, velvety tannins and adds subtle baking spices to the generously ripe aromas and flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 10Span 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this value-minded red is 100% varietal and given two years in French oak. Herbal and earthy, it features tight-grained oak and thick tannin, the dense black cherry and plum fruit concentrated and robustly rich.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Sanctuary 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: Saucy aromas of tomato and herbal berry fruits suggest marginal ripeness, while this is voluminous but unfocused on a jammy palate. Blackberry flavors are sappy and backed by green tannins and herbal notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Luma Chequén 2016 Gran Reserva Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

Description: This wine delivers the Cabernet grape's deep black-fruit flavors and firm tannins with little interference from oak. It is grippy in texture, concentrated and balanced, ready to pair with osso buco or mushroom risotto.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Wonderful Wine Co 2018 Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Description: This celebrity namesake wine opens in a pungent earthiness as a touch of reduction hits the nose. The tannins are robustly built and still quite young. Generous berry richness grips on the midpalate, accented in black pepper, cedar and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vanderpump 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This gutsy, fresh and flavorful wine smells like charcoal and crushed blackberries, and tastes ripe and jammy. It's enjoyable and easy to gulp while keeping its firm Cabernet structure.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dough 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Description: Thick, dense tannin and oak lead the way to a concentrated palate of dark-black fruit, tar and leather in this value-minded wine, which is blended with 6% Merlot. In time, it settles to reveal a softer, more balanced side, enjoyable and approachable in understated richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Long Meadow Ranch 2018 Farmstead Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strongly fruit-driven aromas of boysenberry and strawberry meet with pepper spice and tarragon on the tangy nose of this bottling. There's an extracted black-plum flavor to the palate, where licorice, purple-flower and mint elements also arise.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peloton 2017 Lunacy Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Perfumed oak takes a turn into smoky, toasted territory in this forceful, powerfully built wine. Powerfully concentrated black-cherry and blackberry flavors match a richness of sweet heat and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Archimedes 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Perfumed oak takes a turn into smoky, toasted territory in this forceful, powerfully built wine. Powerfully concentrated black-cherry and blackberry flavors match a richness of sweet heat and dried herb.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Archimedes 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: Aromas of blue flower and black-skinned berry lead the nose. On the soft, juicy palate, light tannins accompany fleshy Morello cherry, blackberry and a hint of cocoa while fresh acidity keeps it tangy. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caruso & Minini 2018 Cusora Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

Description: This hearty, full-bodied wine is not shy about its grilled plum, iron and charcoal flavors. They give it an earthy, rustic quality that's appetizing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Knotty Vines 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This smooth, mellow wine glides gently over the palate, offering baking spices over rich blackberry and blueberry notes. Although full bodied, it's well integrated and balanced for a wine in this price range.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Tribute 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: With delicious opening aromas and flavors of dark cherry, plum and cassis, this opulent red is soft in tannins and the oak is integrated. Dust, mocha and dried fruit notes accent an abbreviated finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Typhon Estates 2017 Lumen Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Description: An aroma of smoked meat leads to beefy, peppery flavors in this firmly tannic, oaky, full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oak Farm 2017 Trevoli Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Herbal, earthy and high-toned in currant and cranberry, this mountain wine is robustly ripe and intensely powerful. Thick tannins grip the palate and don't let go, as a finish of toasted oak and vanilla builds steam.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thurlow 2017 Kingsnake Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh green herb aromas are out front along with satsuma notes. The flavors are light and direct. Decant for best effect.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2017 Skull & Chain Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Description: Candied red currant, sumac and carnation aromas make for a slightly sweet entry to the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh strawberry side to the palate at first, followed by hints of leather, tea leaves and espresso bean. It's a lightly bodied, playful wine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: SeatPocket 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Woody, dusty and gravely in texture, this hyperripe wine is dry and features refined tannins. The fruit is exceedingly rich in syrupy cherry, raspberry and currant.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Typhon Estates 2018 Ignis Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subdued aromas of cocoa, cranberry and cherry are followed by pulled back fruit flavors that paint around the edges. The concentration seems quite light and the tannins bunched up. It seems to be in an odd spot.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: North by Northwest 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This rich, smoky, full-bodied wine is saturated with blackberries and black cherries and interlaced with generous woodsmoke and toasted oak flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box NV Nighthawk Black Bourbon Barrel Aged Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of green herb, cherry, raspberry, medicine and dark chocolate. Medicinal and dried fruit flavors follow, with the tannins showing some astringency. It brings surprisingly tart acids for the vintage.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Elevation Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This full-bodied wine is very solid in quality, especially for the price, offering good, ripe black-cherry and plum flavors, mild tannins and a mouthfilling texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box NV Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Fresh fruits like cherries and strawberries dominate the generous flavors of this medium-bodied, easy-drinking wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bucket List NV Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This is an easygoing, uneventful red, subdued in red fruit, dried herb and cedar, with a soft, simple structure and length. It finishes in tobacco and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Burnside Road 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: All of the winery's 2017 reserve red wines have strong scents of vanilla, coffee and tobacco. Here, the fruit manages to add hints of black cherry and some savory notes. The wine quickly turns quite tannic and astringent.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dark plum, violet, asphalt and wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted berry and plum flavors meet with savory touches of cedar on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Europa Village 2017 C'est la Vie Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

Description: This is a pleasant, light version of Cabernet, offering fresh raspberry and strawberry flavors, medium body and no tannin to speak of.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Zoom Juice 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Herbal with notes of cedar and clove, this approachable wine is both tart and intense, with waves of blackberry and currant.                      Virginie Boone
Name: August Briggs 2016 Two Moon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Black pepper and black plum flavors give this medium-bodied wine good substance on the palate while smooth, light tannins enhance the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brownstone NV Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This heavily spiced and medium-bodied wine sports woodsmoke and black-pepper flavors that contrast with an almost tart black-cherry center.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three Girls 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Powerful tannins are almost too much for this wine. They dominate the black currant flavors of the Cabernet Sauvignon, a grape that seems out of place in the Douro. The extraction has left a bitter edge and this wine probably will not soften enough.                      Roger Voss
Name: Colinas do Douro 2018 Quinta da Extrema Grande Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Duriense)

Description: This full-bodied and lightly tannic wine focuses on vivid clove aromas and tasty black-cherry and clove flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Spellbound 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas provide notes of green herb, campfire smoke, spearmint, orange peel and plum, seeming quite underripe. The palate is soft, light, savory and citrusy, pulling up short.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sail to Trail WineWorks 2017 Cuvée 4 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied organic wine offers a raw, smoky, tangy aroma and rather tart red-fruit flavors braced by light tannins. No added sulfites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2019 Biodynamic Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)

Description: Herbaceous flavors of dried onion and bell pepper dominate this medium- to full-bodied wine that has a bit of tannin in the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Keynote 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is dominated by a superripe cherry aroma and flavor, and has moderate tannins for a grippy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Trinity Oaks 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Good olive and raspberry aromas are muffled by intensely oaky flavors and drying tannins in this deep-colored and full-bodied wine. Char, cedar and menthol take over the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: California Republic 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Stalky aromas of olive and berry fruits are a bit harsh, while this Cabernet Sauvignon is blocky, tannic and flat in feel. Stewy flavors of raisiny berry fruits and green herbs don't change or improve on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vinos de Arganza 2016 Palacio de Arganza Cabernet Sauvignon (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

Description: This is a decent, mature wine that shows nutty aromas, mild fruit flavors and a soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Insomnia NV Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This earthy, edgy wine has an aroma of raspberry vinegar and rather tart red-cherry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: PaintBox NV Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: This estate-grown blend combines 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc, allowing the main variety to speak loudest. Gorgeously perfumed, it unfurls wave after wave of cassis, dusty rock and cocoa powder—seasonings that boost secondary characteristics of black and red currant and cherry. With structure and complexity to spare, it should do well over time; enjoy best from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Joseph Phelps 2017 Insignia Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: From the producer's first site that was planted in 1970, this wine is sumptuous in blackberry, fig and dark chocolate. A bright wisp of cassis shines on the midpalate, enlivening the bold, supple texture. Underlying layers of crushed rock and iron provide a welcome and intriguing minerality that highlights the finish. Best from 2027–2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from a mighty appellation, this is thickly concentrated in black fruit, with robust tannins and oak to carry it through. Specks of coconut and vanilla contrast against a sturdy wall of black pepper, iron and crushed rock, finishing with powerful intensity and length. Best from 2025–2035.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mira 2015 Schweizer Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: This wine is 100% varietal and aged in entirely new French oak, the grapes grown on a rocky slope at 1,425 feet in elevation. Sinewy on the palate, it offers flavors of leather, mocha and dark berry, with background notes of coffee and dark chocolate. It packs plenty of punch and opulence while still retaining enviable grace and complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Hideaway Vineyard Chappellet Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine from the best lots of two of the producer's prized sites, Fay and S.L.V., this wine is richly expansive in red fruit, balanced by bright acidity and lengthy structure. Clove, black pepper, black olive and a dash of dark chocolate mingle on the palate. Best from 2027–2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: Juicy on the palate and supple in tannin, this wine opens in a swirl of caramel apple, dark cherry and dust—flavors full of tension and powerful concentration. Herbal and spicy in equal measure, it delivers robust complexity and intense structure, able to age well over time. Enjoy best from 2027–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alpha Omega 2017 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Appellation: Stags Leap District, Napa, California, US
Description: From the historic site where Stag's Leap first began, this is nearly 100% varietal, with just 1.5% Cabernet Franc. It delivers a lifted, floral character dipped in tangy red fruit. The tannins are pillowy and supple, with a structure will last. Enjoy from 2027–2037.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

Description: Layered in black olive, currant and red and black cherry, this wine is effusively perfumed, herbal and balanced, with a tremendous amount of underling power. Toasted oak and clove dust the fruit and provide a mineral component that contrasts well, accentuating its overall structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2017 Renteria 360 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

Description: Juicy black fruit and rocky minerality combine with force to create a lasting impression in this incredible wine from the wild appellation. Baking spice, clove, sage and herb wrap around a length of complex structure and persistent power, with just enough acidity to keep it fresh. Enjoy best from 2027–2032.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alpha Omega 2017 Drew Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite dark in the glass, this reliable crowd-pleaser begins with hearty aromas of black currant, black plum, lush oak and caramel, accented by a hint of olive and loads of clove and nutmeg. The mouthfeel is hearty and rich, with just enough tannic weight to balance the creamy black-cherry, caramel and chocolate-ice-cream flavors, which lead to an oaky finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Austin Hope 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This impressively structured wine, with just 3% Petit Verdot, is ample in a robut blackberry jam tone. Iron, tobacco, lavender and dried herb ride along the midpalate with ease. The black pepper on the finish is additionally on point. Enjoy from 2026–2036.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Mira 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Made from estate-grown grapes, this wine opens in soft, supple tannins and a wealth of powerful black fruit. Expansive and weighty on the palate, it unfurls integrated acidity throughout. Black pepper, dried herb and crushed rock components give it an enduring earthiness. Enjoy from 2026–2036.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J. Davies 2016 Jamie Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

Description: The inaugural release made by Andy Erickson, this comes from the owner's Stags Ridge Vineyard atop Atlas Peak, at 1,400-feet in elevation and planted in 1999. Thick, tannic and earthy, it buzzes in dried herb, sage, flint and a rich intensity of blackberry, plum and vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Seven Apart 2018 Expedition Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Beautifully inviting aromas entice one into a world of blueberry, dark cherry and cassis in this layered, luxurious wine. With small amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot included in the blend, it is soft, supple and sultry on the lengthy palate, with a spicy finish of nutmeg, clove and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Kintera Wines 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Description: From the producer's estate vineyard on the eastern side of the valley, this 100% varietal wine opens in a wealth of nutmeg, cinnamon and clove, giving it a spicy edge on the palate. Dark fruit, toasted oak and thick tannin wrap around each other in well-integrated layers of power and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Janzen 2017 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of freshly smashed boysenberry, açaí sorbet and purple flowers make for a vibrant nose in this bottling from the brand's Adelaida Springs Ranch, located just 12 miles from the coast at 1,700 feet in elevation. Those fruity, floral tones are upheld by tight tannins on the otherwise lush palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2017 Mountain Road Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Entirely varietal, this bold red is herbal and earthy, brimming in cedar, clove and blue fruit. Robust and hearty, it has a graceful undercurrent of freshness and lively acidity, providing a seamless, structured experience of length and elegance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ghost Block 2017 Ghost Block Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)

Description: Richly concentrated yet elegant in style, this wine is brimming in dense layers of baked plum, mocha and leather. The tannins are sinewy and supportive, with great structure and power.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Diamond Creek 2017 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Woody in spice and oak, this appellation wine is powerfully built, with a lift of acidity that keeps it fresh and lively in the glass. Cigar box, tobacco and ample red fruit glide across the palate with ease and length, integrated in tannin and weight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Davies 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Description: From a part of the property deep in rocky soils and rich in iron, this wine offers a wealth of herbal intensity and dusty rock. Light baking spices highlight the well-integrated oak, pillowy tannin structure and elegant black fruit, finishing in a cohesive, seamless whole of ripe balance.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Diamond Creek 2017 Red Rock Terrace Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Made by Winemaker Jeff Ames, this Cabernet Sauvignon includes 7% Cabernet Franc and 7% Petit Verdot. Aged in 100% new French oak, it offers a seamless core of cassis, raspberry and dark cherry, with velvety richness forming a concentrated bond on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anthem Winery 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

Description: Sourced from Beckstoffer Heritage Vineyards, this red includes 4% Sangiovese. Soft, velvety red and black cherry adorn sweet tannin, integrated oak and lifted acidity, making for a balanced, cohesive whole of full-bodied richness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bacio Divino 2017 An Artful Red Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Highly regarded StoneTree Vineyard is the dominant fruit source for this wine. Coffee, dried herb and black-cherry aromas lead to a palate that brings a whole lot of seriousness to it. It's rich and dense, full of tannic heft. Give it time to stretch its legs—and drink it at a cool temperature—to see it at its best. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Luke 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot and 8% Malbec this wine delivers tremendous value, the quality impressive. Sinewy and intensely concentrated in black fruit, iron and crushed rock, it has secondary aspects of dried herb and leather that expand across the palate voluptuously.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2017 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of earth, dark cherry, flower, black currant and raspberry, showing a compelling sense of detail. The palate is dense, full of plum flavors, backed by tightly wound tannins and accented by bright acidity. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's hard to resist now but will only get better with time in the cellar. Best from 2026–2032.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: DeLille 2017 Shaw Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a blend of fruit from Upchurch (30%), Ciel du Cheval (27%), Grand Ciel (24%) and Klipsun vineyards (19%). The aromas offer notes of sautéed dried herb, raspberry, dry chocolate and earth. Dense, fresh coffee and cherry flavors follow. It lingers on the finish, showing a pleasing sense of brightness. It drinks well now but seems to be immortal. Best after 2026.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: DeLille 2017 Four Flags Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though five years old, this wine is still quite young and tightly wrapped in a savory coating. Aromas of baked black cherry and blueberry meet with crushed rocks, dried herbs and leather on the nose. The palate is very dry, full of oregano and more leather, with a bit of black plum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pegasus Estate 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Composed from the start, this flush but supple Cabernet makes favorable points right off the bat. Full-fledged cassis and spiced plum aromas are lush but poised and elevated. A forward-leaning palate with medium-bright acidity and smooth tannins stages cherry, plum and cassis flavors that are long and pure. Chocolate notes appear on a lightly oaked finish; drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carmen 2017 Gold Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Description: Composed from the start, this flush but supple Cabernet makes favorable points right off the bat. Full-fledged cassis and spiced plum aromas are lush but poised and elevated. A forward-leaning palate with medium-bright acidity and smooth tannins stages cherry, plum and cassis flavors that are long and pure. Chocolate notes appear on a lightly oaked finish; drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carmen 2017 Gold Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of roasted coffee, cherry, black currant, scorched earth and plum. The flavors show restraint and sophistication, with plenty of stuffing. The acidity of the vintage brightens it. It has a very long life ahead. Best after 2026.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: DeLille 2016 Grand Ciel Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: For the price, this delicious bottling is hard to beat. Aromas of blackberry pie, caramel and light oak are approachable and appealing. The palate is wrapped in tight-enough tannins to uphold the joyous black-plum and blackberry-pie flavors, which are enhanced by savory touches of meat and black olive. It finishes on a hint of mint.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Vines 2018 The Kinker Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal and aged in 100% new French oak, the aromas offer notes of ripe black cherry, incense and char. Rich, intense fruit flavors follow. It's a big hammer of a wine, bringing power like only this producer can bring it. Toast notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gorman 2017 Albatross Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is all McQueen and LeFore vineyard fruit. Coffee and barrel-spice aromas are in the lead at present. The palate is packed full of tannins and acid structure, with the fruit currently playing second fiddle. It needs time in the cellar for the oak to integrate. Best after 2026.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Doubleback 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This wine offers outstanding value, blending in small amounts of Merlot and Petite Sirah and spending 18 months in French oak. Dark, brooding blackberry and plum flavors meet a heartiness of toast and caramel in a powerfully built experience of approachable smoothness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Edge 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: From the coolish appellation in a warm vintage, this robust red offers thick, rich layers of blackberry, dark cherry and cocoa powder, sinewy tannins providing a sturdy foundation that adds to its overall power. Underlying acidity provides a welcome freshness as a soft finish builds.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Faust 2017 The Pact Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum, crushed berry and crushed rock aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which aims to be a leaner style of Cab. The palate is very tense and chalky, with tannins wrapped around the fresh blackberry and black-plum flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Harrington 2018 Wheeler Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (San Benito County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and snappy black- and red-fruit aromas meet with wet stone and light herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and fun with black peppercorns, crisp blackberry and richer black-cherry tones that ride acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: The Hideaway 2018 Time Will Tell, We Won't Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from McQueen, Lefore, Bob Healy, Seven Hills and Figgins vineyards. Vibrant aromas of char, dark chocolate, coffee, cherry and barrel spice lead to a pleasingly restrained palate, with a tart snap of acidity. It shows the variety's sophisticated side. Best after 2025.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Doubleback 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This is a thick and herbal wine from the great site, richly woven in cigar box, clove and toasted oak. Structured and dusty on the palate in iron and crushed rock, it has a richness of underlying cassis and dark currant and should do well in the cellar. Enjoy best from 2027–2030.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Alpha Omega 2017 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

Description: Plum, blackberry and cassis aromas are forward and flush as they lead to a grabby, concentrated palate with warmth. Ripe flavors of cassis, black cherry and licorice finish steady and long, with dry tannins. This nonvintage winner is 75% Cabernet Sauvignon from 2017 blended with smaller parts of Cabernet from 2016, 2015 and 2014. Drink through 2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carmen NV Vintages Blend II Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This full-bodied, ripe wine is soft and richly layered in a warmth of baking spice and mellow tannin, the fruit jammy and lush. Baked cherry, cassis and a trace of vanilla accent the toasted oak and make for an appealingly cohesive experience on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Eleven Eleven 2016 Laki's Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

Description: This complex and well-layered wine is a true standout. It offers intriguing tobacco, earth and cedar aromas, well-knit flavors of black cherry, tamarind and olive, all wrapped in a solid, firm texture. Composed and well balanced, it will drink well through at least 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Highway 12 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh raspberry, bittersweet chocolate and dried herb pop on the nose. The palate is ripe, delicious, fruit filled and lip-smacking, displaying a lot of density, intensity and texture. Give this beauty a short decant if drinking in the near term.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Luke 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Dusty, woody oak dominates on the entry of this wine, settling into a complementary relationship with its thick blue-fruit and supple tannin. Clove, black pepper, crushed rock and tobacco provide savory contrast and complexity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Patland 2016 Select Barrel Reserve Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: Incorporating 20% Merlot as well as a smattering of Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is a rich, layered wine that is soft and supple on the palate. Cedar, black pepper and dried herb highlight a seamless stretch of tannin as bold flavors of black and red currant cut in, finishing in mocha.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, lilac, cinnamon and clove aromas converge on the complex nose of this bottling. The palate ranges from hibiscus and cherry to strawberry and rose petals, with plenty of layers to keep the taste buds entertained.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McPrice Myers 2018 Bull by the Horns Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This full-bodied, rich and saturated wine offers abundant black cherry, black olive and toasted oak flavors on a firm texture of moderate, fine-grained tannins. It brings a lot of sensory pleasure from its deep, dark color to the velvety mouthfeel and baking spice accents that linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Olsen and Solaksen vineyards. Seeing no new oak, the aromas are pulled back, with notes of herb, anise, fresh black currant and plum. Exquisitely pure dark-fruit flavors follow. It's a window into a pure expression of the variety, absolutely delicious.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Virtue 2018 Charisma Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Dark-cherry and berry fruit dominates in this 100% varietal wine, the tannins well integrated and showing soft, supple appeal. Mocha, toasted oak and vanilla round out the experience on the palate, dotted in black pepper and clove.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whitehall Lane 2017 Millennium MM Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berry aromas meet with crushed rocks, dusty soil and hints of sagebrush on the nose of this reserve bottling. It's lighter bodied in style, offering muddled strawberry and red-plum flavors with a mineral-driven, rocky-flavored core, leading into an oregano-dusted finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Focused aromas of dried cherry, soy, leather, smoked oak and coffee candy show on the nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is hearty and full, carrying flavors of blackberry jam, coffee cream and a generous helping of oak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: My Story 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of roasted black cherry, fig, caramel and milk chocolate make for a rich and gooey entry to the nose of this appellation blend. Lavish, creamy and smooth tannins frame the sip, where roasted plum, fig and raisin flavors are framed by a more rigid structure toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of roasted black cherry, fig, caramel and milk chocolate make for a rich and gooey entry to the nose of this appellation blend. Lavish, creamy and smooth tannins frame the sip, where roasted plum, fig and raisin flavors are framed by a more rigid structure toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vina Robles 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: A broad, fleshy and lengthy wine, 100% varietal, this wine is dark and brooding in black cherry and cassis, with complementary accents of crushed rock and cocoa powder. Toasted oak and vanilla round out the plush finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whitehall Lane 2017 Leonardini Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 8% Petit Verdot and aged in 90% new French oak, this wine's roasted coffee-bean and dark-chocolate aromas are up front, followed by notes of cherry liqueur. Plentiful, sensuous chocolate and cherry flavors follow, lingering on the finish. It shows both the vintage and the winery's hedonistic style.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gorman 2017 The Bully Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasant aromas of dark berry, toasted wood, coffee bean and roasted cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. Chalky tannins make for firm tension on the palate, where those berry and cocoa tones ride fresh acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Cote Del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Cote Del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Forceful tannins dominate in this powerful, youthful wine from the producer's own estate. Entirely varietal, it is densely built, ripe and lush in cassis, black cherry and blackberry, with a finishing touch of caramel oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whitehall Lane 2017 Leonardini Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles Geneseo District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle aromas of smashed berries and light violet make for a mellow, measured entry into the nose of this bottling from an appellation on the east side of Paso Robles. The palate is cohesive with açaí, Concord grape and dark-berry-sorbet flavors, enhanced by wood spice, light pepper and purple flowers, with lingering acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Geneseo District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pleasant aromas of dark berry, toasted wood, coffee bean and roasted cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. Chalky tannins make for firm tension on the palate, where those berry and cocoa tones ride fresh acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Cote Del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Cote Del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: From a blend of beautiful sites across the valley, including Arcadia Vineyard in Coombsville and Rancho Chimiles in Wooden Valley, as well as small amounts of grapes from S.L.V. and Fay, this wine is inviting in dense aromas of red fruit, caramel and brioche. With dashes of Petit Verdot and Malbec, it finishes on accents of tobacco and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2018 Artemis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: A hearty, iron-rich and red-fruited estate wine from the high-elevation mountain, delivers this wine with bold, beautiful layers of complex flavor and texture. Dusty, crushed rock components add to its earthy core.                      Virginie Boone
Name: J. Davies 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

Description: With 10% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot, this mountain wine is tannic and structured, with brawny, leathery black and blue fruit. Softened on the midpalate, it builds additional intensity toward the finish, ending in a note of clove, black pepper and toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Cakebread 2017 Dancing Bear Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Big, very ripe and velvety, this full-bodied wine is packed with black cherry, black fig and a dash of baking spices. It's quite smooth, moderately tannic and easy to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Shannon Ridge 2017 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, powerfully structured and full-bodied, with intensely robust black fruit. Soft, supple tannin and integrated oak give it a rounded opulence that makes it delicious and enjoyable in its youth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Covenant 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This is a big yet nicely restrained wine, backing its flavors of black cherry and dark chocolate with moderate tannins. Its appetizing texture slowly releases layers of depth and flavor with time in the glass. Best through 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Michael Pozzan 2018 Giapoza Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Polished and well balanced, this flavorful and moderately tannic wine fits the bill nicely for a well-priced Cabernet. It has a full body, a concentrated black cherry flavor and subtle hints of chocolate and vanilla.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noble Vines 2018 337 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

Description: Made from Glass Mountain Vineyard in St. Helena and Williamson in Oak Knoll, this 100% varietal wine is aged in 100% new French oak. Woody, herbal, savory and feral, it has subdued black fruit, sage, leather and tobacco that ride along a thickness of tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Paulownia 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated cherry, crushed stone, silty dust and light oregano aromas kick off the nose. The palate is rich and viscous in black cherry, nutmeg and vanilla flavors, which ride tight tannins and fresh acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pull 2017 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: This wine has rich red fruit with well-integrated acidity and is well structured, with full-bodied ripeness and power. Hints of baking spice and clove liven the black cherry and cassis.                      Virginie Boone
Name: A. Toraño 2016 Mi Cielo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

Description: This wine offers great value for the quality, a weighty and intense expression of dark plum, woody oak and baking spice. Notes of iron, clove and tobacco add to the firm, supple tannin and structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Beringer 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A 100% varietal wine from one site, this red is earthy and wild, with thick, concentrated blackberry and rich vanilla. The tannins are intensely structured and powerfully smooth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2016 Rapp Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with both Malbec (13%) and Merlot (12%), this wine's roasted coffee-bean, scorched earth, herb and raspberry aromas lead to fruit and barrel flavors that have a pleasing acidic lift. It will have a very long life ahead of it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Blended with 6% Petit Verdot, this is a thick, leathery and tannic red wine, robust in both new and neutral oak. Dry, it offers black currant, tobacco, cedar and clove within an approachable, full-bodied package.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whitehall Lane 2017 Mancino Lanciatore Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: This stalwart, firmly tannic wine wraps concentrated black-fruit flavors in a full body and grippy texture. It will dazzle with a juicy steak or chop, and stay enjoyable through at least 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hook or Crook 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of pencil eraser, dried cherry, cassis and natural spices are savory and complex. On the palate, this is syrupy and held together by dry tannins. Minty, medicinal plum and berry flavors settle on spicy, and overall this is quite different than the usual big fruit-oak-herbal trio that many Chilean Cabernets revert to.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Lafken 2017 Single Vineyard Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this wine are ripe and fruitful, with blackberry and black cherry showing pleasing purity. There's plenty of density and intensity to the flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dixie & Bass 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with both Malbec (13%) and Merlot (12%), this wine's roasted coffee-bean, scorched earth, herb and raspberry aromas lead to fruit and barrel flavors that have a pleasing acidic lift. It will have a very long life ahead of it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lobo Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of blue fruit, dried herb, barrel spice and graphite lead to plentiful plum flavors. A fresh lick of acidity keeps it all in focus, despite the high labeled abv. There's plenty of tannin to back it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gorman 2018 Old Scratch Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subtle aromas of matchstick, cherry and herb lead to plentiful black-currant, plum and herb flavors brightened by tart acids. It hasn't come out of its shell yet but has the stuffing to excel when it does.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Airfield Estates 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

Description: Earthy and thickly concentrated, this robust wine is intensely flavored and dark. Tobacco, cedar and clove flavors accent a core of rich blackberry, black cherry and vanilla, finishing on a dusting of dark chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bartholomew Estate 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

Description: This is a brawny, approachable and likable wine, thick in tannin and oak. Dark berry, cola, vanilla and a thread of lasting baking spice highlight the full-bodied, soft and supple palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Bluewing Vineyards 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red berries, cocoa and new leather aromas show on the nose of this reliable bottling from a regional icon. There is a hefty feeling to the chalky, sandy tannins, zippy acidity and familiar flavors of dark red fruit, herbs and turned earth.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Castoro Cellars 2018 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: From a variety of sites, this good-value wine overdelivers on its price point, offering sanguine notes of olive, crushed rock and cassis and currant. The oak is well integrated and nuanced in toasty notes. There's a softness to the midpalate that appeals in balanced lushness.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Emerson Brown 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Description: A small addition of Petit Verdot adds to the full-bodied power of this wine, approachable in its well-integrated tannin and oak. Brawny blackberry and currant ride alongside mocha, vanilla and woody toasted notes.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Whitehall Lane 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Packed with superripe black fruits, this full-bodied and lightly tannic wine is concentrated and mouthfilling. Dried cherries, black olives and prunes flood the taste buds.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Occasio 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of dried thyme and oregano lead into blackberry, baked soil and crushed stone on the nose of this bottling. Those herbal elements rise on the sip as well, meeting with fig paste and berry jam on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Opolo 2017 Reserve Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Description: Bold, concentrated but soft, this full-bodied wine boasts a core of black cherry and blueberry, generous baking spice and woodsmoke accents, all wrapped in a creamy texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Hook or Crook 2018 Vintners Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of rubbery berry fruits, hard spices, raw oak and wild brush improve with breathing prior to a palate with mildly astringent tannins. Oaky flavors of plum and berry include hints of green herbs, coffee and baking spices, while this feels dry on a finish that's short on fruit and length. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Dos Almas 2017 Famiglia Zonin Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied red-cherry, tangy berry and dried fennel-stalk aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines smashed plum and cherry with savory peppercorn, leather and dried meat flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Porlier 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine is quite concentrated and firmly tannic, packing in dense black-olive and bell-pepper flavors that are accented by vanilla and cedar. While a bit gangly now, it should be pretty tasty after 2021.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Buena Vista 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe red-berry aromas are jammy on the nose of this bottling, yet the pepper and herb components hold the attention. Oregano and pepper meet with oak and dark red fruit on the palate, which shows a slight tang of acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas suggest notes of graphite, bittersweet chocolate, cigar box, anise, flower and dark cherry. Soft, reserved flavors follow. It needs more tannin structure to fully stand it up but it's an enjoyable expression.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lady Hill 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Savory aromas of dried meat, crushed herbs, peppercorn and ripe, dark fruits show on the nose of this bottling. There's a strong cherry-jam streak to the palate, which is lifted by dried herbs and spearmint tones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2018 Devine Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Well structured and balanced, this full-bodied wine fills the palate with ripe but not jammy plum and black-cherry flavors backed by moderate tannins. It's a very good, substantial wine to pair with red meat.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skyside 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
